Short Description: All Austrian firms must show a true and fair view of their financial statements
Austria increased the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 30 to 34 percent).
Joined the European Union.
Requirement to prepare annual accounts.
Requirement to prepare consolidated accounts.
Companies were allowed to prepare financial statements for conslidated accounts using IFRS/IAS instead of local GAAP for fiscal years beginning after December 31, 1997 (KonzaG, 26 March 1999).
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 7 to unlimited years.
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Einkommensteuergesetz 1988, das Körperschaftsteuergesetz 1988,das Umgründungssteuergesetz, das Umsatzsteuergesetz 1994,das Bewertungsgesetz 1955, das Bodenschätzungsgesetz 1970, das Normverbrauchuchsabgabegesetz, das Energieabgaben- vergütungsgesetz,das Tabak, Alkohol,Bier,Schaumwein,Mineralölsteuergesetz 1995,die Bundes abgabenordnung, das Abgabenverwaltungsorganisationgesetz, das Zollrechts-Durchführungs gesetz,das Bundesgesetz über den unabhängingen Finanzsenat,das Finanzstrafgesetz, das Kommunalsteuergesetz 1993 und das Ausfuhrerstattungsgesetz geändert werden (AbgÄG 2003). BGBl n° 124 vom 19/12/2003 p. 1683
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Income Tax Act 1988, the Corporation Tax Act 1988, the Turnover Tax Act, the 1994 Turnover Tax Act, the Valuation Act 1955, the Land Estimation Act 1970, the Standard Consumption Tax Act, the Energy Tax Remuneration Act, Tobacco, Alcohol, Beer, Sparkling Wine, Mineral Oil Tax Act 1995, the Federal Tax Code, the Tax Administration Organisation Act, the Customs Law Implementation Act, the Financial Crime Act, the 1993 Local Tax Act and the Export Refunds Act (AbgÄG 2003). Federal Law Gazette No 124 of 19/12/2003 p. 1683
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.

Local_language: Änderung des Kapitalmarktgesetzes, des Börsegesetzes, des Investmentfondsgesetzes, des Wertpapieraufsichtsgesetzes und des Finanzmarktaufsichtsbehördengesetzes
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Capital Markets Act, the Stock Exchange Act, the Investment Funds Act, the Securities Supervision act and the Financial Markets Supervisory Authority Act
Short Description: Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
Introduction of a cross-border group taxation system that allows intra-company loss offsetting across borders.
Austria reduced the corporate tax rate by 9 percentage points (from 34 to 25 percent).

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Börsegesetz und das Wertpapieraufsichtsgesetz geändert werden
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Berufsrechts-Änderungsgesetz für Notare, Rechtsanwälte und Ziviltechniker 2006
English_translation: Law amending the Professional Law for Notaries, Lawyers and Civil Technicians
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Übernahmegesetz, das Handelsgesetzbuch, das Börsegesetz, das Umwandlungsgesetz und das Spaltungsgesetz geändert werden und ein Bundesgesetz über den Ausschluss von Minderheitsgesellschaftern erlassen wird (ÜbernahmerechtsÄnderungsgesetz 2006 – ÜbRÄG 2006)
English_translation: Federal Act by which the Takeover Act, the Commercial Code, the Stock Exchange Act, the conversion law and the law on division are amended and a federal law is adopted. on the exclusion of minority shareholders (Law amending the law on transfer rights) 2006 – ÜbRÄG 2006)
Short Description: The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers.

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Unternehmensgesetzbuch, das Aktiengesetz 1965, das GmbH-Gesetz, das SE-Gesetz, das Genossenschaftsgesetz, das Genossenschaftsrevisionsgesetz, das Spaltungsgesetz, das Luftfahrtgesetz, das Bankwesengesetz und das Versicherungsaufsichtsgesetz geändert werden (Unternehmensrechts-Änderungsgesetz 2008 – URÄG 2008) /// Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Abschlussprüfungs-Qualitätssicherungsgesetzes und das Wirtschaftstreuhandberufsgesetz geändert werden /// Bundesgesetz über die Wirtschaftstreuhandberufe (Wirtschaftstreuhandberufsgesetz 2017 – WTBG 2017)
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Companies Code, the Companies Act 1965, the GmbH Act, the SE Act, the Cooperatives Act, the Cooperatives Revision Act, the Division Act, the Aviation Act, the Banking Act and the Insurance Supervision Act (Company Law Amendment Act 2008 – URÄG 2008) /// Federal Act amending the Statutory Audit Quality Assurance Act and the Public Accountants Act
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Aktiengesetz 1965, das SE-Gesetz, das Unternehmensgesetzbuch, das Umwandlungsgesetz, das Spaltungsgesetz, das Kapitalberichtigungsgesetz, das Gesellschafter-Ausschlussgesetz, das Übernahmegesetz, das Genossenschaftsrevisionsgesetz und das Grundbuchsgesetz geändert werden (Aktienrechts-Änderungsgesetz 2009 – AktRÄG 2009) /// Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Aktiengesetz 1965, das SE-Gesetz, das Unternehmensgesetzbuch, das Umwandlungsgesetz, das Spaltungsgesetz, das Kapitalberichtigungsgesetz, das Gesellschafter-Ausschlussgesetz, das Übernahmegesetz, das Genossenschaftsrevisionsgesetz und das Grundbuchsgesetz geändert werden (Aktienrechts-Änderungsgesetz 2009 – AktRÄG 2009)
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Companies Act 1965, the SE Act, the Companies Code, the Transformation Act, the Law on Division, the Capital Adjustment Act, the Shareholders Exclusion Act, the Takeover Act, the Cooperatives Revision Act and the Land Register Act (Stock Corporation Law Amendment Act 2009 – AktRÄG 2009) /// Federal Act amending the Companies Act 1965, the SE Act, the Companies Code, the Transformation Act, the Law on Division, the Capital Adjustment Act, the Shareholders Exclusion Act, the Takeover Act, the Cooperatives Revision Act and the Land Register Act (Stock Corporation Law Amendment Act 2009 – AktRÄG 2009)
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
Austria is the last country to implement an IFRS enforcement system.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: EU-Amtshilfegesetz als Teil des AbgabenänderungsG 2012 /// Bundesgesetz, mit dem das EU-Amtshilfegesetz erlassen wird und das Einkommensteuergesetz 1988, das Körperschaftsteuergesetz 1988, das Umgründungssteuergesetz, das Umsatzsteuergesetz 1994, das Bewertungsgesetz 1955, das Bauern- Sozialversicherungsgesetz, das Bodenschätzungsgesetz 1970, das Gebührengesetz 1957, das Glücksspielgesetz, das Grunderwerbsteuergesetz 1987, das Versicherungssteuergesetz 1953, das Kraftfahrzeugsteuergesetz 1992, das Flugabgabegesetz, das Neugründungs-Förderungsgesetz, das Stiftungseingangssteuergesetz, die Bundesabgabenordnung, das Abgabenverwaltungsorganisationsgesetz 2010, das Normverbrauchsabgabegesetz 1991, das Biersteuergesetz 1995, das Mineralölsteuergesetz 1995, das Alkoholsteuergesetz, das Schaumweinsteuergesetz 1995, das Tabaksteuergesetz 1995, das Tabakmonopolgesetz 1996, das Finanzstrafgesetz und das Ausfuhrerstattungsgesetz geändert werden (Abgabenänderungsgesetz 2012 – AbgÄG 2012) /// Verordnung des Bundesministers für Finanzen betreffend die Durchführung des automatischen Informationsaustausches
English_translation: EU Mutual Assistance Act as part of the 2012 Tax Amendment Act /// Federal Act adopting the EU Mutual Assistance Act and The Income Tax Act 1988, the Corporation Tax Act 1988, the Re-establishment Tax Act, the 1994 Turnover Tax Act, the Valuation Act 1955, the Farmers Social Insurance Act, the Land Estimation Act 1970, the Fees Act 1957, the Gambling Act, the Land Transfer Tax Act 1987, the Insurance Tax Act 1953, the 1992 Law on motor vehicle tax, the Law on flight tax, New Start-up Funding Act, the Foundations Entrance Tax Act, the Federal Tax Code, the Tax Administration Organisation Act 2010, the Standard Consumption Tax Act 1991, the Beer Tax Act 1995, the Mineral Oil Tax Law 1995, which: Alcohol Tax Act, the Sparkling Wine Tax Act 1995, the Tobacco Tax Act 1995, which: Tobacco Monopoly Act 1996, the Financial Crime Act and the Export Refunds Act amended (Amendment Act 2012 – AbgÄG 2012) /// Regulation of the Federal Minister for Finance concerning the implementation of the automatic exchange of information
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

Local_language: BMF: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Börsegesetz 1989, das Kapitalmarktgesetz und das Rechnungslegungs-Kontrollgesetz geändert werden
English_translation: BMF: Federal Act amending the 1989 Stock Exchange Act, the Capital Market Act and the Accounting Control Act
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

English_translation: Audit Law Amendment Act, Federal Act on the Supervision of Statutory Auditors and Audit Firms
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem zur Verbesserung der Nachhaltigkeits- und Diversitätsberichterstattung das Unternehmensgesetzbuch, das Aktiengesetz und das GmbH-Gesetz geändert werden (Nachhaltigkeits- und Diversitätsverbesserungsgesetz, NaDiVeG)
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Companies Code, the Stock Corporation Act and the GmbH Act in order to improve sustainability and diversity reporting (Sustainability and Diversity Improvement Act, NaDiVeG)
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Gemeinsamer Meldestandard-Gesetz (GMSG) /// Verordnung des Bundesministers für Finanzen zur Durchführung des Gemeinsamen Meldestandard-Gesetzes (GMSG-DV) /// Abgabenänderungsgesetz 2015 – AbgÄG 2015
English_translation: Common Reporting Standard Act (GMSG) /// Regulation of the Federal Minister for Finance implementing the Common Reporting Standard Act (GMSG-DV) /// Tax Amendment Act 2015 – AbgÄG 2015
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Verrechnungspreisdokumentationsgesetz erlassen, das Einkommensteuergesetz 1988, das Finanzstrafgesetz, das Kontenregister- und Konteneinschaugesetz, das Kapitalabfluss-Meldegesetz, das Gemeinsamer Meldestandard-Gesetz, das EU-Amtshilfegesetz, das Zollrechts-Durchführungsgesetz, das Bewertungsgesetz 1955, das Körperschaftsteuergesetz 1988 und die Bundesabgabenordnung geändert und das EU-Quellensteuergesetz aufgehoben werden (EU-Abgabenänderungsgesetz 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016)
English_translation: Federal Act adopting the Transfer Pricing Documentation Act, the Income Tax Act 1988, the Financial Crime Act, the Account Register and Account Inspection Act, the Capital Outflow Reporting Act, the Common Reporting Standard Act, the EU Official Assistance Act, the Customs Law Implementing Act, the Valuation Act 1955, the Corporation Tax Act 1988 and the Federal Tax Code, and repeal of the EU withholding tax law (EU Tax Amendment Act 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016)
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Verrechnungspreisdokumentationsgesetz erlassen, das Einkommensteuergesetz 1988, das Finanzstrafgesetz, das Kontenregister- und Konteneinschaugesetz, das Kapitalabfluss-Meldegesetz, das Gemeinsamer Meldestandard-Gesetz, das EU-Amtshilfegesetz, das Zollrechts-Durchführungsgesetz, das Bewertungsgesetz 1955, das Körperschaftsteuergesetz 1988 und die Bundesabgabenordnung geändert und das EU-Quellensteuergesetz aufgehoben werden (EU-Abgabenänderungsgesetz 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016)
English_translation: Federal Act enacting the Transfer Pricing Documentation Act, amending the Income Tax Act 1988, the Finance Crime Act, the Account Register and Account Survey Act, the Cash Outflow Act, the Common Reporting Standard Act, the EU Mutual Assistance Act, the Customs Law Implementing Act, the Valuation Act 1955, the Corporation Tax Act 1988 and the Federal Tax Code and repeal the EU source tax law (EU-AbgÄG 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016).
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Verrechnungspreisdokumentationsgesetz erlassen, das Einkommensteuergesetz 1988, das Finanzstrafgesetz, das Kontenregister- und Konteneinschaugesetz, das Kapitalabfluss-Meldegesetz, das Gemeinsamer Meldestandard-Gesetz, das EU-Amtshilfegesetz, das Zollrechts-Durchführungsgesetz, das Bewertungsgesetz 1955, das Körperschaftsteuergesetz 1988 und die Bundesabgabenordnung geändert und das EU-Quellensteuergesetz aufgehoben werden (EU-Abgabenänderungsgesetz 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016)
English_translation: Federal Act adopting the Transfer Pricing Documentation Act, the Income Tax Act 1988, the Financial Crime Act, the Account Register and Account Inspection Act, the Capital Outflow Reporting Act, the Common Reporting Standard Act, the EU Official Assistance Act, the Customs Law Implementing Act, the Valuation Act 1955, the Corporation Tax Act 1988 and the Federal Tax Code, and repeal of the EU withholding tax law (EU Tax Amendment Act 2016 – EU-AbgÄG 2016)
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Bundesgesetz über die Umsetzung der OECD-Grundsätze der internationalen abgabenrechtlichen Amtshilfe (Amtshilfe-Durchführungsgesetz – ADG) /// Bundesgesetz, mit dem ein Bundesgesetz über die Einrichtung eines Registers der wirtschaftlichen Eigentümer von Gesellschaften, anderen juristischen Personen und Trusts (Wirtschaftliche Eigentümer Registergesetz – WiEReG) erlassen wird und das Finanzmarkt-Geldwäschegesetz, das Finanzstrafgesetz, die Notariatsordnung, die Rechtsanwaltsordnung, das Devisengesetz, das Bankwesengesetz, die Bundesabgabenordnung, das Finanzmarktaufsichtsbehördengesetz und das Energieabgabenvergütungsgesetz geändert werden
English_translation: Federal Act on the Implementation of the OECD Principles of International tax assistance (Official Assistance Implementing Act – ADG) /// Federal Act adopting a Federal Act on the establishment of a register of beneficial owners of companies, other legal entities and trusts (Beneficial Ownership Register Act – WiEReG) and amending the Financial Market Money Laundering Act, the Financial Crime Act, the Notarial regulations, the Lawyers’ Code, the Foreign Exchange Act, the Banking Act, the Federal Tax Code, the Financial Market Supervisory Authority Act and the Energy Tax Reimbursement Act
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: BMF: Umsetzung von Art. 92 mit Bundesgesetz über die Sanierung und Abwicklung von Banken sowie Änderung des Bankwesengesetzes, des Finanzmarktaufsichtsbehördengesetzes, der Insolvenzordnung, des Übernahmegesetzes, des Wertpapieraufsichtsgesetzes 2007, des Alternativen Investmentfonds Manager-Gesetzes, des Ratingagenturenvollzugsgesetzes und des Stabilitätsabgabegesetzes und Aufhebung des Bankeninterventions- und –restrukturierungsgesetzes /// Börsegesetz 2018 und Wertpapieraufsichtsgesetz 2018
English_translation: MF: Transposition of Article 92 with Federal Act on Bank Recovery and Resolution and amendments to the Banking Act, the Financial Market Supervisory Authority Act, the Insolvency Code, the Takeover Act, the 2007 Securities Supervision Act, the Alternative Investment Funds Managers Act, the Credit Rating Agencies Enforcement Act and the Stability Charge Act and repeal of the Bank Intervention and Restructuring Act /// Stock Exchange Act 2018 and Securities Supervision Act 2018
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Börsegesetz geändert wird /// Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Aktiengesetz, das SE-Gesetz, das Übernahmegesetz und das Unternehmensgesetzbuch geändert werden (Aktienrechts-Änderungsgesetz 2019 – AktRÄG 2019)
English_translation: Federal Act amending the Stock Exchange Act /// Federal Act amending the Companies Act, the SE Act, the Takeover Act and the Companies Code
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: EU-Meldepflichtgesetz (EU-MPfG), § 49c Finanzstrafgesetz (Umsetzung des Art 25a der Richtlinie)
English_translation: EU Reporting Obligation Act (EU-MPFG), Section 49c of the Financial Criminal Act (transposition of Article 25a of the Directive)
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.
The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Bundesgesetz, mit dem das Bundesgesetz zur Gewährleistung einer globalen Mindestbesteuerung für Unternehmensgruppen erlassen wird und die Bundesabgabenordnung sowie das Unternehmensgesetzbuch geändert werden (Mindestbesteuerungsreformgesetz – MinBestRefG)
English_translation: Federal Act adopting the Federal Act on ensuring a global minimum level of taxation for groups of companies and amending the Federal Tax Code and the Companies Code (MinBestRefG)
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Introduction of thin capitalization rules (limitation of tax deductibility of interest paid to shareholders). Replaced in 2008 by an interest barrier.
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 4 to unlimited years.
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.

Milestones: Revision of going concern audit standard
Short Description: Increased auditor going concern reporting responsibilities.
Belgium reduced the corporate tax rate by 6.18 percentage points (from 40.17 to 33.99 percent).

Local_language: Arrêté royal du 22/12/2003 modifiant l'AR/CIR 92 en vue de renoncer à la perceprion du précompte mobilier sur les intérêts et les redevances alloués ou mis en paiement à des sociétès associées. MB du 31/12/2003 ///  4 JUILLET 2004. - Loi modifiant le Code des impôts sur les revenus 1992 en vue de permettre la transposition de la directive du Conseil de l'Union européenne du 3 juin 2003 (2003/49/CE) concernant un régime fiscal commun applicable aux paiements d'intérêts et de redevances effectués entre des sociétés associées d'Etats membres différents /// 13 AOUT 2004. - Arrêté royal modifiant l'AR/CIR 92 en vue de renoncer à la perception du précompte mobilier sur les intérêts et les redevances alloués ou mis en paiement à des sociétés associées
English_translation: Royal Decree of 22/12/2003 amending the Royal Decree/CIR 92 in order to waive the levying of withholding tax on interest and royalties granted or paid to associated companies. MB of 31/12/2003 ///  4 JULY 2004. — Law amending the Income Tax Code 1992 with a view to transposing Council Directive 2003/49/EC of 3 June 2003 on a common system of taxation applicable to interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States /// 13 AUGUST 2004. — Royal Decree amending Royal Decree/CIR 92 in order to waive the levying of withholding tax on interest and royalties allocated or charged to associated companies
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

The New York Stock Exchange opens the market segment 'Alternext Brussels', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards. The market was renamed to 'Euronext Growth' on May 17, 2017.
Aims to eliminate the tax debt bias by creating a tax deduction for the cost of capital.
IFRS permitted for private firms (consolidated statements).

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

"The eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) is a standard to convert financial information to structured data so that it can be exchanged and processed electronically." (Kaya and Pronobis, 2016)
Unlisted banks and credit institutions are required to use IFRS in their consolidated statements.
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

Local_language: FOD Economie, KMO, Middenstand en Energie - 10 augustus 2009 - Koninklijk besluit tot wijziging van het koninklijk besluit van 30 januari 2001 tot uitvoering van het Wetboek van Vennootschappen en van het koninklijk besluit van 12 september 1983 tot bepaling van de minimumindeling van een algemeen rekeningstelsel /// SERVICE PUBLIC FEDERAL JUSTICE - 6 AVRIL 2010. - Loi visant à renforcer le gouvernement d'entreprise dans les sociétés cotées et les entreprises publiques autonomes et visant à modifier le régime des interdictions professionnelles dans le secteur bancaire et financier.
English_translation: FPS Economy, SMEs, Self-Employed and Energy – 10 August 2009 – Royal Decree amending the Royal Decree of 30 January 2001 implementing the Companies Code and the Royal Decree of 12 September 1983 laying down the minimum classification of a general chart of accounts /// FEDERAL JUSTICE PUBLIC SERVICE — 6 APRIL 2010. — Law to strengthen corporate governance in listed companies and autonomous public enterprises and to amend the regime of professional bans in the banking and financial sector.
Short Description: Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

English_translation: 27 April 2007 – programme Law (Chapter III – Section 1, Arts 97, 98, 99, 100)
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.
Introduction of an intellectual property box that decreased the tax rate on patent income to 6.8%

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

English_translation: PUBLIC SERVICE FEDERAL FINANCES 27 JUNE 2016. — Law amending, with a view to transposing Directive 2013/50/EU and the implementation of the Regulation 596/2014, of the Act of 2 August 2002 on supervision on the financial sector and financial services, of the law of 16 June 2006 on the public offering of investment instruments and the admission of investment instruments to the trading on a regulated market and of the law of 2 May 2007 on the disclosure of major holdings in issuers whose shares are admitted to trading on a regulated market and containing various provisions, and containing various provisions ///   PUBLIC SERVICE FEDERAL FINANCE – 11 SEPTEMBER 2016. — Royal Decree amending, in order to transpose Directive 2013/50/EU, the Royal Decree of 14 November 2007 on the obligations of issuers of financial instruments admitted to trading on a regulated market and the Royal Decree of 14 February 2008 on the disclosure of major shareholdings and amending the Royal Decrees of 27 April 2007 on takeover bids and public buy-out bids and the Royal Decree of 21 August 2008 laying down detailed rules for certain multilateral trading facilities.
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: Loi portant organisation de la profession et de la supervision publique des réviseurs d’entreprises
English_translation: Law on the organisation of the profession and public supervision of corporate auditors
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: SERVICE PUBLIC FEDERAL ECONOMIE, P.M.E., CLASSES MOYENNES ET ENERGIE - 3 SEPTEMBRE 2017. - Loi relative à la publication d'informations non financières et d'informations relatives à la diversité par certaines grandes sociétés et certains groupes.
English_translation: PUBLIC SERVICE FEDERAL ECONOMY, P.M.E., MIDDLE CLASSES AND ENERGY — 3 SEPTEMBER 2017. — Law on disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large companies and groups.
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.
DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.
DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Federale Overheidsdienst Kanselarij van de Eerste Minister - 26 MAART 2018. — Wet betreffende de versterking van de economische groei en de sociale cohesie
English_translation: Federal Public Service Chancellery of the Prime Minister – 26 March 2018. — Law on strengthening economic growth and social cohesion
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)
Belgium reduced the corporate tax rate by 4.41 percentage points (from 33.99 to 29.58 percent).

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Major revision of Belgium company law, including more options of legal structures, a company not submitting their annual report within seven months after the end of the fiscal year can now legally be dissolved (instead of 3 years and 7 months), and cap on the legal liability of directors. The new company law is effective for newly formed companies from January 1st, 2019, and for all firms from January 1st, 2024.

The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Belgium reduced the corporate tax rate by 4.58 percentage points (from 29.58 to 25 percent).
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

English_translation: FEDERAL PUBLIC FINANCE SERVICE 25 DECEMBER 2017. — Law on corporate tax reform /// FEDERAL PUBLIC SERVICE FINANCE 25 DECEMBER 2017. — Law on corporate tax reform
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: FEDERALE OVERHEIDSDIENST FINANCIEN - 19 DECEMBER 2023. — Wet houdende de invoering van een minimumbelasting voor multinationale ondernemingen en omvangrijke binnenlandse groepen
English_translation: FEDERAL PUBLIC FINANCE SERVICE – 19 DECEMBER 2023. — Law introducing a minimum tax for multinational companies and large-scale domestic groups
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Закон за пазарите на финансови инструменти
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: Закон за корпоративното подоходно облагане /// Закон за корпоративното подоходно облагане /// Закон за изменение и допълнение на Закона за корпоративното подоходно облагане
English_translation: Corporate Income Tax Act /// Corporate Income Tax Act /// Act amending the Corporate Income Tax Act
Short Description: The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Закон за изменение и допълнение на Данъчно-осигурителния процесуален кодекс
English_translation: Act amending and supplementing the Tax and Social Insurance Procedure Code
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Закон за изменение и допълнение на Закона за корпоративното подоходно облагане ///  Закон за изменение и допълнение на Закона за корпоративното подоходно облагане
English_translation: Act amending and supplementing the Corporate Income Tax Act /// Act amending and supplementing the Corporate Income Tax Act
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

Local_language: Закон за изменение и допълнение на Закона за корпоративното подоходно облагане
English_translation: Act amending and supplementing the Corporate Income Tax Act
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Закон за изменение и допълнение на Закона за счетоводството
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Croatia increased the corporate tax rate by 10 percentage points (from 25 to 35 percent).
Croatia reduced the corporate tax rate by 15 percentage points (from 35 to 20 percent).

English_translation: Accounting Act, Official Gazette of the Republic of Croatia, no. 146 (2005).
Short Description: The first Accounting Act of 1991 required all firms to use the International Accounting Standards (IAS). The Second Act states that only large, listed and financial sector companies must apply IFRS, but smaller firms can choose between the Croatian Financial Reporting Standards (CFRS) and the IAS.

English_translation: Accounting Act, Official Gazette of the Republic of Croatia, no. 109 (2007).
Short Description: Small and medium-sized entities can only use CFRS, the option to use the International Accounting Standards was removed.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021

(ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Zakon o trgovačkim društvima (pročišćeni tekst) /// Zakon o izmjenama i dopunama Zakona o trgovačkim društvima /// Zakon o izmjenama i dopunama Zakona o trgovačkim društvima
English_translation: Commercial Companies Act (consolidated text) /// Act amending the Companies Act /// Act amending the Companies Act
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." “IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
