IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
Several accounting standards are replaced with a new single standard.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)
Denmark allows English-only annual reports.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Lov nr. 118 af 7. februar 2012 om gensidig bistand ved inddrivelse af fordringer i forbindelse med skatter, afgifter og andre foranstaltninger samt administrativt samarbejde på beskatningsområdet /// Lov om gensidig bistand ved inddrivelse af fordringer i forbindelse med skatter, afgifter og andre foranstaltninger samt administrativt samarbejde på beskatningsområdet1) /// Lov om gensidig bistand ved inddrivelse af fordringer i forbindelse med skatter, afgifter og andre foranstaltninger samt administrativt samarbejde på beskatningsområdet1)
English_translation: Law No 118 of 7 February 2012 on mutual assistance for the recovery of claims relating to taxes, duties and other measures and administrative cooperation in the field of taxation; /// Law on mutual assistance for the recovery of claims relating to taxes, duties and other measures and administrative cooperation in the field of taxation (1) /// Law on mutual assistance for the recovery of claims relating to taxes, duties and other measures and administrative cooperation in the field of taxation (1)
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Local_language: Lov nr. 738 af 1. juni 2015 om ændring af årsregnskabsloven og forskellige andre love
English_translation: Act No 738 of 1 June 2015 amending the Financial Statements Act and various other Acts
Short Description: Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af revisorloven og forskellige andre love (Gennemførelse af ændringer i revisordirektivet og valgmuligheder i forordningen om særlige krav til revision af virksomheder af interesse for offentligheden) /// Bekendtgørelse om registrering af revisorer og revisionsvirksomheder, der ikke har hjemsted her i landet, i et andet EU-land eller i et EØS-land /// Lov om ændring af revisorloven
English_translation: Act amending the Auditors Act and various other Acts (Implementation of amendments to the Auditor Directive and options in the Regulation on specific requirements for audits of public-interest entities) /// Order on the registration of auditors and audit firms not: is based in Denmark, in another EU country or in an EEA country /// Act amending the Auditors Act
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af årsregnskabsloven og forskellige andre love
English_translation: Act amending the Financial Statements Act and various other Acts
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Lov nr. 1634 af 26. december 2013 om ændring af skattekontrolloven og forskellige andre love Lov nr. 1884 af 29. december 2015 om ændring af skattekontrolloven, arbejdsmarkedsbidragsloven, kildeskatteloven, ligningsloven og pensionsbeskatningsloven /// Bekendtgørelse nr. 1361 af 20. november 2015 om identifikation og indberetning af finansielle konti med tilknytning til udlandet
English_translation: Act No 1634 of 26 December 2013 amending the Tax Control Act and various other Acts Act No 1884 of 29 December 2015 amending the Tax Control Act, the Labour Contribution Act, the Withholding Tax Act, the Tax Assessment Act and the Pensions Taxation Act /// Order No 1361 of 20 November 2015 on the identification and reporting of financial accounts related to abroad
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Lov nr. 1554 om ændring af chokoladeafgiftsloven, ligningsloven, skattekontrolloven og forskellige andre love (§ 7).
English_translation: Act No 1554 amending the Chocolate Tax Act, the Tax Assessment Act, the Tax Control Act and various other Acts (Section 7).
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Lov om chokoladeafgiftsloven, ligningsloven, skattekontrolloven og forskellige andre love - lov nr. 1554 af 13. december 2016 - § 7
English_translation: Act on the Chocolate Tax Act, the Tax Assessment Act, the Tax Control Act and various other Acts – Act No 1554 of 13 December 2016 – Section 7
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Lov nr. 1554 om ændring af chokoladeafgiftsloven, ligningsloven, skattekontrolloven og forskellige andre love (§ 7).
English_translation: Act No 1554 amending the Chocolate Tax Act, the Tax Assessment Act, the Tax Control Act and various other Acts (Section 7).
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af aktieavancebeskatningsloven, kildeskatteloven, skattekontrolloven og forskellige andre love
English_translation: Act amending the Taxation of Shares Act, the Withholding Tax Act, the Tax Control Act and various other Acts
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af selskabsskatteloven, lov om ophævelse af dobbeltbeskatning i forbindelse med regulering af forbundne foretagenders overskud (EF-voldgiftskonventionen), momsloven og forskellige andre love. /// Lov om ændring af selskabsskatteloven og fondsbeskatningsloven (Implementering af skatteundgåelsesdirektivets minimumskrav til medlemsstaternes CFC-regler) /// Lov om ændring af selskabsskatteloven, lov om ophævelse af dobbeltbeskatning i forbindelse med regulering af forbundne foretagenders overskud (EF-voldgiftskonventionen), momsloven og forskellige andre love
English_translation: Act amending the Corporation Tax Act, the Act on the elimination of double taxation in connection with the adjustment of profits of associated enterprises (EC Arbitration Convention), the VAT Act and various other Acts. /// Act amending the Corporation Tax Act and the Fund Tax Act (Implementation of the minimum requirements of the Tax Avoidance Directive for Member States’ CFC rules) /// Act amending the Corporation Tax Act, the Act on the elimination of double taxation in connection with the adjustment of profits of associated enterprises (EC Arbitration Convention), the VAT Act and various other laws
Short Description: The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af skatteindberetningsloven, skattekontrolloven, kildeskatteloven, ligningsloven og pensionsbeskatningsloven /// Bekendtgørelse om indberetning af grænseoverskridende ordninger
English_translation: Act amending the Tax Reporting Act, the Tax Control Act, the Withholding Tax Act, the Tax Assessment Act and the Pensions Taxation Act /// Order on the reporting of cross-border arrangements
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

Local_language: Lov om ændring af selskabsskatteloven, lov om ophævelse af dobbeltbeskatning i forbindelse med regulering af forbundne foretagenders overskud (EF-voldgiftskonventionen), momsloven og forskellige andre love. /// Lov om ændring af selskabsskatteloven, lov om ophævelse af dobbeltbeskatning i forbindelse med regulering af forbundne foretagenders overskud (EF-voldgiftskonventionen), momsloven og forskellige andre love.
English_translation: Act amending the Corporation Tax Act, the Act on the elimination of double taxation in connection with the adjustment of profits of associated enterprises (EC Arbitration Convention), the VAT Act and various other laws. /// Act amending the Corporation Tax Act, the Act on the elimination of double taxation in connection with the adjustment of profits of associated enterprises (EC Arbitration Convention), the VAT Act and various other laws.
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Lov om en ekstraskat for visse koncernenheder (minimumsbeskatningsloven)
English_translation: Act on a top-up tax for certain constituent entities (Minimum Taxation Act)
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Lov nr. 735 af 13. juni 2023 om ændring af årsregnskabsloven (Implementering af Europa-Parlamentets og Rådets direktiv (EU) 2021/2101 for så vidt angår offentliggørelse af selskabsskatteoplysninger for visse virksomheder og filialer m.v.)
English_translation: Act No 735 of 13 June 2023 amending the Financial Statements Act (Implementation of Directive (EU) 2021/2101 of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards disclosure of income tax information by certain undertakings and branches, etc.)
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.

XBRL became mandatory in Denmark starting for small firms (Accounting class B) with fiscal years ending on January 31, 2012. Medium-sized firms (accounting class C) with fiscal year ending after december 31. Public firms  (accounting class D) with fiscal year ending after December 31, 2013.
Estonia reduced the corporate tax rate by 9 percentage points (from 35 to 26 percent).
Defined the basic mandatory accounting and reporting requirements.
Corporate tax is based on distributed, but not on reinvested profits.
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 5 to 7 years.
IFRS permitted for consolidated and unconsolidated financial statements (required for some).

"The purpose of the AA 2003 was to create the legal bases and establish general requirements for organizing accounting and financial reporting pursuant to internationally recognized principles." (Alver and Alver, 2017)

Increased enforcement in 2003 Q4: "The Estonian Financial Supervision Authority (EFSA) dedicated one staff member to the enforcement of compliance with accounting standards in October 2003. The hiring was in response to the requirement in the IAS Regulation and in anticipation of IFRS reporting, but occurred more than a year before the IFRS mandate took effect. Less than 20 firms are listed on the Tallinn Stock Exchange. In 2003, the first sanctions were imposed including: (i) public disclosure of errors and (ii) restatements of financial statement information." (Christensen, Hail and Leuz 2013)
Joined the European Union.

English_translation: AMENDMENTS TO THE INCOME TAX ACT, THE LOCAL TAX ACT AND THE TAX ADMINISTRATION ACT1
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

Local_language: VÄÄRTPABERITURU SEADUSE, FINANTSINSPEKTSIOONI SEADUSE, EESTI VÄÄRTPABERITE KESKREGISTRI SEADUSE, RAHAPESU JA TERRORISMI RAHASTAMISE TÕKESTAMISE SEADUSE NING KREDIIDIASUTUSTE SEADUSE MUUTMISE SEADUS
English_translation: ACT AMENDING THE SECURITIES MARKET ACT, THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISION AUTHORITY ACT, THE ESTONIAN CENTRAL REGISTER OF SECURITIES ACT, THE PREVENTION OF MONEY LAUNDERING AND TERRORIST FINANCING ACT AND THE CREDIT INSTITUTIONS ACT
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: ÄRISEADUSTIKU JA SELLEGA SEONDUVATE SEADUSTE MUUTMISE SEADUS /// ÄRISEADUSTIK
English_translation: ACT AMENDING THE COMMERCIAL CODE AND RELATED LAWS /// COMMERCIAL AFFAIRS
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. Exemption for SMEs, otherwise all companies have to prepare transfer pricing documentation.

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

English_translation: AUDIT AUTHORITIES1 /// Audit Activities Act /// Establishment of the Register of Auditing Activities and Statutes for the maintenance of the Register
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: KÄIBEMAKSUSEADUSE MUUTMISE SEADUS /// Käibemaksumääraga 9% maksustatavad ravimid, rasestumisvastased vahendid, sanitaar- ja hügieenitooted, meditsiiniseadmed ning abivahendid
English_translation: ACT AMENDING THE VALUE ADDED TAX ACT /// Pharmaceuticals, contraceptives, sanitary and hygiene products, medical equipment and accessories subject to a VAT rate of 9 %
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.
Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). English_translation: Law No 2015-1786 of 29 December 2015 amending budget for 2015 (1) /// Decree No 2016-1683 of 5 December 2016 laying down rules and procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information, known as the Common Reporting Standard /// Order of 9 December 2016 specifying Decree No 2016-1683 of 5 December 2016 laying down rules and procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information, known as the ‘common reporting standard’
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.
Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Articles L. 114 et 114 A du livre des procédures fiscales (extrait du LPF)
English_translation: Articles L. 114 and 114A of the Tax Procedures Book (extract from the LPF)
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.
DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: LOI no 2019-486 du 22 mai 2019 relative à la croissance et la transformation des entreprises /// Ordonnance no 2019-1234 du 27 novembre 2019 relative à la rémunération des mandataires sociaux des sociétés cotées
English_translation: Law No 2019-486 of 22 May 2019 on the growth and transformation of enterprises /// Ordinance No 2019-1234 of 27 November 2019 on the remuneration of representatives of listed companies
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: Loi n° 2019-486 du 22 mai 2019 relative à la croissance et la transformation des entreprises
English_translation: Law No. 2019-486 of May 22, 2019, on the Growth and Transformation of Companies
Short Description: Introduced size thresholds for the appointment of a statutory auditors. Before all entities regardless of the comopany size had to be audited.

The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Ordonnance 2019-1068 du 21 octobre 2019 relative à l’échange automatique et obligatoire d’informations dans le domaine fiscal en rapport avec les dispositifs transfrontières devant faire l’objet d’une déclaration /// Décret n° 2020-270 du 17 mars 2020 fixant les informations contenues dans la déclaration d'un dispositif transfrontière mentionnée à l'article 1649 AD du code général des impôts
English_translation: Ordinance 2019-1068 of 21 October 2019 on mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation in relation to reportable cross-border arrangements /// Decree No 2020-270 of 17 March 2020 laying down the information contained in the declaration of a cross-border arrangement referred to in Article 1649 AD of the General Tax Code
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.
France reduced the corporate tax rate by 3.6125 percentage points (from 32.02 to 28.4075 percent).

Local_language: Loi n°2019-1479 du 28 décembre 2019 de finances pour 2020 /// Finance Law No 2019-1479 of 28 December 2019 for 2020
English_translation: Finance Law No 2019-1479 of 28 December 2019 for 2020 /// Finance Law No 2019-1479 of 28 December 2019 for 2020
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: LOI n° 2023-1322 du 29 décembre 2023 de finances pour 2024
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: LOI n° 2023-171 du 9 mars 2023 portant diverses dispositions d'adaptation au droit de l'Union européenne dans les domaines de l'économie, de la santé, du travail, des transports et de l'agriculture (NOR : ECOX2229741L) publiée au JORF n°0059 du 10 mars 2023 /// Ordonnance n° 2023-1142 du 6 décembre 2023 relative à la publication et à la certification d'informations en matière de durabilité et aux obligations environnementales, sociales et de gouvernement d'entreprise des sociétés commerciales /// Décret n° 2023-1394 du 30 décembre 2023 pris en application de l'ordonnance n° 2023-1142 du 6 décembre 2023 relative à la publication et à la certification d'informations en matière de durabilité et aux obligations environnementales, sociales et de gouvernement d'entreprise des sociétés commerciales
English_translation: Law No 2023-171 of 9 March 2023 on various provisions adapting to European Union law in the fields of economy, health, labour, transport and agriculture (NOR: ECOX2229741L) published in JORF No 0059 of 10 March 2023 /// Ordinance No 2023-1142 of 6 December 2023 on the disclosure and certification of sustainability information and the environmental, social and corporate governance obligations of commercial companies /// Decree No 2023-1394 of 30 December 2023 adopted pursuant to Ordinance No 2023-1142 of 6 December 2023 on the publication and certification of sustainability information and the environmental, social and corporate governance obligations of commercial companies
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: LOI n° 2023-171 du 9 mars 2023 portant diverses dispositions d'adaptation au droit de l'Union européenne dans les domaines de l'économie, de la santé, du travail, des transports et de l'agriculture (NOR : ECOX2229741L) publiée au JORF n°0059 du 10 mars 2023 /// Ordonnance n° 2023-1142 du 6 décembre 2023 relative à la publication et à la certification d'informations en matière de durabilité et aux obligations environnementales, sociales et de gouvernement d'entreprise des sociétés commerciales /// Décret n° 2023-1394 du 30 décembre 2023 pris en application de l'ordonnance n° 2023-1142 du 6 décembre 2023 relative à la publication et à la certification d'informations en matière de durabilité et aux obligations environnementales, sociales et de gouvernement d'entreprise des sociétés commerciales
English_translation: Law No 2023-171 of 9 March 2023 on various provisions adapting to European Union law in the fields of economy, health, labour, transport and agriculture (NOR: ECOX2229741L) published in JORF No 0059 of 10 March 2023 /// Ordinance No 2023-1142 of 6 December 2023 on the disclosure and certification of sustainability information and the environmental, social and corporate governance obligations of commercial companies /// Decree No 2023-1394 of 30 December 2023 adopted pursuant to Ordinance No 2023-1142 of 6 December 2023 on the publication and certification of sustainability information and the environmental, social and corporate governance obligations of commercial companies
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Germany reduced the corporate tax rate by 4.34 percentage points (from 56.52 to 52.17 percent).

Milestones: Segment 'Neuer Markt' requires IAS or US GAAP
Short Description: The Frankfurt Stock Exchange requires all firms listed in the market segment "Neuer Markt" to apply the International Accounting Standards (IAS) or US GAAP.

Local_language: Gesetz Zur Kontrolle Und Transparenz Im Unternehmensbereich - KonTraG
English_translation: Act on Control and Transparency of Enterprises
Short Description: Increased audit reporting requirements and increased legal liability of auditors.
German firms listed on EU-regulated markets are allowed to use the International Accounting Standards (IAS) instead of German GAAP for their consolidated accounts.
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.
Germany reduced the corporate tax rate by 4.01283008 percentage points (from 56.0460251 to 52.03319502 percent).
Corporate taxation changed to a classical corporate tax system, i.e. the corporation is taxed and shareholders pay taxes on received dividends.
Germany reduced the corporate tax rate by 13.13 percentage points (from 52.03 to 38.9 percent).
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets have to declare the degree of compliance with the German Corporate Governance Code.
Firms listed on the EU-regulated market segment 'Prime Standard' (the segment with the highest transparency criteria) are required to use the International Accounting Standards.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Sec. 90 of the General Tax Code (GTC) Decree regarding the Determination and Documentation of Profits (Oct. 2003) " (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
All German firms are allowed to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements instead of German GAAP.
Establishment of the Audit Oversight Commission.
Increased auditor independence and introduction of internal auditor rotation.
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets in Germany are subject to a new enforcement regime.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Verbesserung des Anlegerschutzes (Anlegerschutzverbesserungsgesetz - AnSVG).
English_translation: Act to improve investor protection (Aninvestor Protection Improvement Act – AnSVG).
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

English_translation: German Corporate Tax Reform Act of 2004
Short Description: Introduction of thin capitalization rules (limitation of tax deductibility of interest paid to shareholders). Replaced in 2008 by an interest barrier.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Ampassung der Vorschriften über die Amtshilfe im Bereich der Europäischen Union sowie zur Umsetzung der Richtlinie 2003/49/EG des Rates vom 3/6/2003 über eine gemeinsame Steuerregelung für Zahlungen von Zinsen und Lizenzgebühren zwischen verbundenen Unternehmen verschiedener Mitgliedstaaten (EG-Amtshilfe-Anpassungsgesetz)
English_translation: Act amending the provisions on mutual assistance in the field of the European Union and implementing Council Directive 2003/49/EC of 3/6/2003 on a common system of taxation applicable to interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States (EC Assistance Adaptation Act)
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.
Germany introduces a minimum tax on the local profit tax

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

The Frankfurt Stock Exchange opens the market segment 'Entry Standard', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards.

Local_language: Gesetz über elektronische Handelsregister und Genossenschaftsregister sowie das Unternehmensregister (EHUG)
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

Local_language: Gesetz Zur Umsetzung Der Protokollerklärung Der Bundesregierung Zur Vermittlungsempfehlung Zum Steuervergünstigungsabbaugeset
English_translation: Act on the Implementation of the Federal Government's Protocol Declaration on the Mediation Recommendation on the Tax Relief Reduction Act
Short Description: Stricter tax-loss offsetting rules.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Richtlinie 2004/25/EG des Europäischen Parlaments und des Rates vom 21. April 2004 betreffend Übernahmeangebote (Übernahmerichtlinie-Umsetzungsgesetz)
English_translation: Act transposing Directive 2004/25/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on takeover bids (Transposition Act)
Short Description: The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers.
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Richtlinie über Märkte für Finanzinstrumente und der Durchführungsrichtlinie der Kommission (Finanzmarktrichtlinie-Umsetzungsgesetz).
English_translation: Law transposing the Markets in Financial Instruments Directive and the Commission Implementing Directive (Financial Markets Directive Implementation Act).
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

The Frankfurt Stock Exchange opens the market segment 'First Quotation Board', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards.
The corporate tax rate was reduced from 39% to 29%.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Stärkung der Berufsaufsicht und zur Reform berufsrechtlicher Regelungen in der Wirtschaftsprüferordnung /// Gesetz zur Modernisierung des Bilanzrechts (Bilanzrechtsmodernisierungsgesetz - BilMoG)
English_translation: Act on strengthening professional supervision and reform rules of professional law in the Code of Accountants /// Law on the modernisation of balance sheet law (BilMoG)
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

English_translation: German Corporate Tax Reform Act of 2008
Short Description: Introduction of interest barrier (limitation of tax deductions on interest expenses). It replaced the 2004 thin capitalization rule.

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary.
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.
German GAAP is revised to have greater alignment with the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). Firms were allowed to adopt the new rules one year in advance.

Court rulings lowered the legal threshold for firms to downlist from an EU-regulated market (IFRS mandatory, high level of enforcement) to exchange-regulated markets (IFRS voluntary, low level of enforcement).

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Aktionärsrechterichtlinie (ARUG) /// Gesetz zum Umsetzung der Aktionärsrechterichtlinie
English_translation: Act transposing the Shareholders’ Rights Directive (ARUG) /// Act transposing the Shareholders’ Rights Directive
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
German GAAP is revised to have greater alignment with the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). Firms were allowed to adopt the new rules one year in advance.

English_translation: German Act on the Amendment of Accounting Law with Respect to Micro-Entities
Short Description: The new size category 'micro' is introduced (next to small, medium, and large), for which disclosure exemption applies.
The Frankfurt Stock Exchange closes the market segment 'First Quotation Board' due to repeated fraud cases.

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary.
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Amtshilferichtlinie sowie zur Änderung steuerlicher Vorschriften (Amtshilferichtlinie-Umsetzungsgesetz - AmtshilfeRLUmsG) /// Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Amtshilferichtlinie sowie zur Änderung steuerlicher Vorschriften (Amtshilferichtlinie-Umsetzungsgesetz - AmtshilfeRLUmsG)
English_translation: Act transposing the Mutual Assistance Directive and amending tax provisions (Official Assistance Directive Implementation Act – Mutual AssistanceRLUmsG) /// Act transposing the Mutual Assistance Directive and amending tax provisions (Official Assistance Directive Implementation Act – Mutual AssistanceRLUmsG)
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

English_translation: Law transposing the Transparency Directive amending the Transparency Directive
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.
Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Stärkung der nichtfinanziellen Berichterstattung der Unternehmen in ihren Lage- und Konzernlageberichten (CSR-Richtlinie-Umsetzungsgesetz)
English_translation: Law on strengthening companies’ non-financial reporting in their situation and group reports (CSR Directive Implementation Act)
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
