English_translation: Law to Strengthen Financial Market Integrity
Short Description: Mandatory audit committees for public interest entities.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Anti-Steuervermeidungsrichtlinie (ATAD-Umsetzungsgesetz – ATADUmsG) /// Law implementing the Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD-Implementing Act – ATADUmsG)
English_translation: Law implementing the Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD-Implementing Act – ATADUmsG) /// Law implementing the Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD-Implementing Act – ATADUmsG)
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

The 2004 Bilanzkontrollgesetz introduced the German Financial Reporting Enforcement Panel (FREP), a private-law entity. However, as a result of the Wirecard scandal, the FREP stopped its activities and the Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BAFIN) is solely responsible for examining the financial statements of publicly listed firms since January 2022.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Richtlinie (EU) 2022/2523 des Rates zur Gewährleistung einer globalen Mindestbesteuerung und weiterer Begleitmaßnahmen
English_translation: Law transposing Council Directive (EU) 2022/2523 on ensuring a global minimum level of taxation and other accompanying measures
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Gesetz über die unternehmerischen Sorgfaltspflichten in Lieferketten
English_translation: Law on corporate due diligence in supply chains
Short Description: The Supply Chain Act requires the establishment of a risk management system to identify, prevent or minimize the risks of human rights violations and damage throughout the supply chain. From 2023, the law will initially apply to companies with at least 3,000 employees, and from 2024 also to companies with at least 1,000 employees in Germany.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Gesetz zur Umsetzung der Richtlinie (EU) 2021/2101 im Hinblick auf die Offenlegung von Ertragsteuerinformationen durch bestimmte Unternehmen und Zweigniederlassungen sowie zur Änderung des Verbraucherstreitbeilegungsgesetzes und des Pflichtversicherungsgesetzes
English_translation: Act transposing Directive (EU) 2021/2101 as regards disclosure of income tax information by certain undertakings and branches and amending the Consumer Dispute Settlement Act and the Compulsory Insurance Act
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Introduction of the 'Code of Ethics' of the audit profession.
Greece increased the corporate tax rate by 5 percentage points (from 35 to 40 percent).
Euro area member since 1 January 2001.
Establishment of the Hellenic accounting and auditing oversight boards.
IFRS permitted for consolidated statements.

Local_language: Αμοιβαία συνδρομή των κρατών-μελών της Ευρωπαϊκής Ένωσης στον τομέα της άμεσης φορολογίας, φορολογία τόκων και άλλες διατάξεις
English_translation: Mutual assistance of the Member States of the European Union in the field of direct taxation, taxation of interest and other provisions
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
Greece reduced the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 35 to 32 percent).

Local_language: Νόμος υπ'αριθ. 3340 για την προστασία της Κεφαλαιαγοράς από πράξεις προσώπων που κατέχουν προνομιακές πληροφορίες και πράξεις χειραγώγησης της αγοράς.
English_translation: Law No. 3340 on the protection of the Capital Market against acts of persons possessing privileged information and acts of market manipulation
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Γενικό Εμπορικό Μητρώο / Αναμόρφωση και τροποποίηση του κωδικοποιημένου νόμου 2190/1920"Περί ανωνύμων εταιρειών"και άλλες διατάξεις
English_translation: General Commercial Register / Reform and amendment of Consolidated Law 2190/1920 on public limited liability companies and other provisions
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.
Greece reduced the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 32 to 29 percent).

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση στο εθνικό δίκαιο της οδηγίας 2004/25/ΕΚ σχετικά με τις δημόσιες προτάσεις
English_translation: Transposition into national law of Directive 2004/25/EC on public proposals
Short Description: The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary.
English_translation: Official publication: Εφημερίς της Κυβερνήσεως (ΦΕΚ) (Τεύχος Α); Number: 127; Publication date: 28/07/2009; Page number: 05749-05758
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Local_language: Προϋποθέσεις διαφάνειας για την πληροφόρηση σχετικά με εκδότες των οποίων οι κινητές αξίες έχουν εισαχθεί προς διαπραγμάρευση σε οργανωμένη αγορά και άλλες διατάξεις / Προσαρμογή της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας: α) στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας 2013/50/ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 22ας Οκτωβρίου 2013 και β) στο άρθρο 1 της Οδηγίας 2014/51/ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 16ης Απριλίου 2014 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Transparency requirements for information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market and other provisions / Adaptation of Greek legislation: the provisions of Directive 2013/50/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 22 October 2013 2013 and (b) Article 1 of Directive 2014/51/EU of European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 and other provisions.
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Greece reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 29 to 25 percent).

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση στην ελληνική έννομη τάξη της Οδηγίας 2006/46/ΕΚ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβούλιου και του Συμβουλίου σχετικά με τους ετήσιους και ενοποιημένους λογαριασμούς εταιρειών ορισμένων μορφών και της οδηγίας 2007/63/ΕΚ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου για την απαίτηση για τη σύνταξη έκθεσης από ανεξάρτητο εμπειρογνώμονα σε περίπτωση συγχώνευσης ή διάσπασης ανωνύμων εταιρειών.
English_translation: Transposition of the Directive into Greek law 2006/46/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the annual and consolidated accounts of certain types of companies and Directive 2007/63/EC Parliament and Council on the requirement to draw up a report by an independent expert in the event of a merger or division of public limited liability companies.
Short Description: Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "2 TP regimes exist in Greece (Ministry of Development and MoF) introduced in mid-2009, documentation required for fiscal years 2008 onwards" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)

Local_language: Εναρμόνιση της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας με την Οδηγία 2006/43/ΕΚ /// Σύστημα αύλων τίτλων.......(άρθρα 30 ,31,32)
English_translation: Alignment of Greek legislation with Directive 2006/43/EC /// System of outward securities....... (art. 30,31,32)
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: ΝΟΜΟΣ ΥΠ΄ΑΡΙΘΜ. 5045/2023 -ΑΡΘΡΟ 67 ΑΠΑΛΛΑΓΗ ΤΑΧΥΔΡΟΜΙΚΩΝ ΥΠΗΡΕΣΙΩΝ ΑΠΟ ΦΠΑ -ΑΝΤΙΚΑΤΑΣΤΑΣΗ ΠΕΡ. α), ΠΑΡ. 1, ΑΡΘΡΟΥ 22 ΚΩΔΙΚΑ ΦΠΑ /// Εμσωμάτωση οδηγιών ......και λοιπών φορολογιών και λοιπές διατάξεις
English_translation: Law No 5045/2023 – Article 67 exemption of postal services from VAT – replacement (a), paragraph 1, Article 22 VAT Code /// Transposition of Directives... and other taxes and other provisions
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Οργανισμοί συλλογικών επενδύσεων σε κινητές αξίες και ανώνυμες εταιρείες διαχείρισης αμοιβαίων κεφαλαίων, Οδηγία 2009/65/ΕΚ. Προσαρμογή της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις των Οδηγιών 2010/ 78/ ΕΕ, 2010/73/ΕΕ, 2011/96/ΕΕ, 2009/133/ ΕΚ, 2004/ 113/ΕK. Ευρωπαϊκή Συνεταιριστική Εταιρεία. Μέτρα εφαρμο γής των Κανονισμών (ΕΚ) 1338/2001 και (ΕΕ) 1210/2010 περί προστασίας του ευρώ και άλλες διατάξεις
English_translation: Undertakings for Collective Investment in Transferable Securities and public limited liability funds management companies, Directive 2009/65/EC. Bringing Greek legislation into line with the provisions of Directives 2010/78/ EU, 2010/73/EU, 2011/96/EU, 2009/133/EC, 2004/113/EC. European Cooperative Society. Implementation measures on the basis of Regulations (EC) No 1338/2001 and (EU) No 1210/2010 on the protection of the euro and other provisions
Short Description: The merger directive prescribes the possibility for enterprises to conduct cross-border mergers in the Union without adverse tax effects

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση στο ελληνικό δίκαιο της Οδηγίας 2007/36/ΕΚ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου, της 11ης Ιουλίου 2007, σχετικά με την άσκηση ορισμένων δικαιωμάτων από μετόχους εισηγμένων εταιρειών – Τροποποίηση και προσαρμογή του κωδικοποιημένου νόμου 2190/1920 Περί ανωνύμων εταιρειών και του ν. 2396/1996. /// Ενσωμάτωση στο ελληνικό δίκαιο της Οδηγίας 2007/36/ΕΚ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου, της 11ης Ιουλίου 2007, σχετικά με την άσκηση ορισμένων δικαιωμάτων από μετόχους εισηγμένων εταιρειών – Τροποποίηση και προσαρμογή του κωδικοποιημένου νόμου 2190/1920 Περί ανωνύμων εταιρειών και του ν. 2396/1996.
English_translation: Transposition into Greek law of Directive 2007/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 July 2007 on the exercise of certain rights of shareholders in listed persons companies – Amendment and adaptation of Consolidated Law 2190/1920 on public limited companies and Law 2396/1996 /// Transposition into Greek law of Directive 2007/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 July 2007 on the exercise of certain rights of shareholders in listed companies – Amendment and adaptation of Consolidated Law 2190/1920 on public limited companies and Law 2396/1996.
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
Greece reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 24 to 20 percent).
Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
Greece increased the corporate tax rate by 6 percentage points (from 20 to 26 percent).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση της Oδηγίας 2011/16/ΕΕ, ρύθμιση θεμάτων της ΕΛ.Τ.Ε., αναμόρφωση Οργανισμού του Ν.Σ.Κ. και άλλες διατάξεις. /// Ενσωμάτωση της Oδηγίας 2011/16/ΕΕ, ρύθμιση θεμάτων της ΕΛ.Τ.Ε., αναμόρφωση Οργανισμού του Ν.Σ.Κ. και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Transposition of Directive 2011/16/EU, regulation of matters ELTE, reform of the organisation of the State Legal Council and other provisions. /// Transposition of Directive 2011/16/EU, regulation of matters ELTE, reform of the organisation of the State Legal Council and other provisions.
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)

Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU, and enhanced accounting comparability between listed and non-listed companies. Law 4308/2014 is the main law that transposed Directive 2013/34/EU into Greek law.

Local_language: Προσαρμογή της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας: α) στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας 2013/50/ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 22ας Οκτωβρίου 2013 και β) στο άρθρο 1 της Οδηγίας 2014/51/ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 16ης Απριλίου 2014 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Adaptation of Greek legislation: (a) Directive 2013/50/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 22 October 2013 and b) Article 1 of Directive 2014/51/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 and other provisions.
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.
DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Υποχρεωτικός έλεγχος των ετήσιων και των ενοποιημένων χρηματοοικονομικών καταστάσεων, δημόσια εποπτεία επί του ελεγκτικού έργου και λοιπές διατάξει / Εταιρική διακυβέρνηση ανωνύμων εταιρειών,σύγχρονη αγορά κεφαλαίου, ενσωμάτωση στην ελληνική νομοθεσία της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2017/828 του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου, μέτρα προς εφαρμογή του Κανονισμού (ΕΕ)2017/1131 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Statutory audit of annual and consolidated financial statements; public oversight of audit work; and other provisions / Corporate governance of public limited liability companies, modern capital market, transposition into Greek law of Directive (EU) 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council, measures implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and other provisions.
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Προσαρμογή της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις των άρθρων 19, 20, 29, 30, 33, 35, 40 έως 46 της Οδηγίας 2013/34/ΕΕ σχετικά με «τις ετήσιες οικονομικές καταστάσεις, τις ενοποιημένες οικονομικές καταστάσεις και συναφείς εκθέσεις επιχειρήσεων ορισμένων μορφών, την τροποποίηση της Οδηγίας 2006/43/ΕΚ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου και την κατάργηση των Οδηγιών 78/660/EOK και 83/349/ ΕΟΚ του Συμβουλίου» (Ε.Ε. L 189 της 29ης Ιουνίου 2013) και στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας 2014/95/ ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου (Ε.Ε. L 330/1 της 15ης Νοεμβρίου 2014) «για την τροποποίηση της Οδηγίας 2013/34/ΕΕ όσον αφορά τη δημοσιοποίηση μη χρηματοοικονομικών πληροφοριών και πληροφοριών για την πολυμορφία από ορισμένες μεγάλες επιχειρήσεις και ομίλους» και άλλες διατάξεις αρμοδιότητας Υπουργείου Οικονομίας, Ανάπτυξης και Τουρισμού.
English_translation: Adaptation of Greek legislation to the provisions of Articles 19, 20, 29, 30, 33, 35, 40 to 46 of Directive 2013/34/EU on the annual financial statements, consolidated financial statements financial statements and related reports certain types of undertakings, amending Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council and repeal of Directives 78/660/EEC and 83/349/EEC The EEC Council (OJ L 189 of 29 June 2013) and the provisions of Directive 2014/95/ OJ of the European Parliament and of the Council (OJ L 330/1 of 15 November 2014) ‘amending Directive 2013/34/EU with regard to the disclosure of non-financial information and information on diversity from certain large companies and groups’ and other provisions under the responsibility of the Ministry of the Economy, Development and Tourism.
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Greece increased the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 26 to 29 percent).
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Προσαρμογή της Ελληνικής Νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2016/881 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Adaptation of Greek legislation to the provisions of Directive (EU) 2016/881 and other provisions.
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Προσαρμογή της ελληνικής νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2015/2376 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Bringing Greek legislation into line with the provisions of Directive (EU) 2015/2376 and other provisions.
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Προσαρμογή της Ελληνικής Νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2016/881 και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Bringing Greek legislation into line with the provisions of Directive (EU) 2016/881 and other provisions.
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: I) Κεντρικά Αποθετήρια Τίτλων, II) Προσαρμογή της Ελληνικής Νομοθεσίας στις διατάξεις της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2016/2258 και άλλες διατάξεις και ΙΙΙ) Λοιπές διατάξεις.
English_translation: (I) Central Securities Repositories, (II) Adjustment Greek legislation on the provisions of Directive (EU) 2016/2258 and other provisions; and (III) Other provisions.
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Αγορές χρηματοπιστωτικών μέσων και άλλες διατάξεις /// Κατάργηση των διατάξεων περί μείωσης των συντάξεων, ενσωμάτωση στην Ελληνική Νομοθεσία της Οδηγίας 2016/97/ΕΕ του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 20ής Ιανουαρίου 2016 σχετικά με τη διανομή ασφαλιστικών προϊόντων και άλλες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Markets in financial instruments and other provisions. /// Repeal of pension reduction provisions, transposition into Greek legislation Directive (EU) 2016/97 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 January 2016 on insurance distribution products and other provisions.
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

New legal framework regulating sociétés anonymes.

Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

English_translation: Tax interventions to strengthen the development process of the Greek economy, transposition into Greek legislation of Directives (EU) 2017/1852, (EU) 2018/822, (EU) 2020/876, (EU) 2016/1164, (EU) 2018/1910 and (EU) 2019/475, State contribution for the repayment of loans of affected borrowers due to the adverse effects of COVID-19 and other provisions. /// Tax interventions to strengthen the development process of the Greek economy, transposition into Greek legislation of Directives (EU) 2017/1852, (EU) 2018/822, (EU) 2020/876, (EU) 2016/1164, (EU) 2018/1910 and (EU) 2019/475, State contribution for the repayment of loans of affected borrowers due to the adverse effects of COVID-19 and other provisions.
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2022/2523 του Συμβουλίου, της 14ης Δεκεμβρίου 2022, σχετικά με την εξασφάλιση παγκόσμιου ελάχιστου επιπέδου φορολογίας των ομίλων πολυεθνικών επιχειρήσεων και των εγχώριων ομίλων μεγάλης κλίμακας στην Ευρωπαϊκή Ένωση (Pillar II) και άλλες επείγουσες διατάξεις. /// Tax Procedure Code and other provisions.
English_translation: Transposition of Council Directive (EU) 2022/2523 of 14 December 2022 on ensuring a global minimum level of taxation for multinational enterprise groups and large-scale domestic groups in the European Union (Pillar II) and other urgent provisions. /// Tax Procedure Code and other provisions.
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Ενσωμάτωση της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2021/2101 του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου και του Συμβουλίου της 24ης Νοεμβρίου 2021 για την τροποποίηση της Οδηγίας (ΕΕ) 2013/34 όσον αφορά στη δημοσιοποίηση στοιχείων φορολογίας εισοδήματος από ορισμένες επιχειρήσεις και υποκαταστήματα - Επικαιροποίηση εθνικής νομοθεσίας για τις υπο- χρεώσεις δημοσιότητας των εταιρειών και άλλες επείγουσες διατάξεις.
English_translation: Transposition of Directive (EU) 2021/2101 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24 November 2021 amending Directive 2013/34/EU as regards disclosure of income tax information by certain undertakings and branches – Update of national legislation on subjects — company disclosure charges and other urgent provisions.
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Hungary reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 40 to 36 percent).
Hungary reduced the corporate tax rate by 18 percentage points (from 36 to 18 percent).
Primary financial reporting legislation, modified the previous one to be closer to international rules.
Joined the European Union on May 1st, 2004
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 5 years to unlimited.

English_translation: Act LXXXI of 1996 on Corporate Tax and Dividend Tax /// Act XCI of 2003 amending the Acts on Taxes, Contributions and Other Budget Payments

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
IFRS is permitted for consolidated statements. IFRS is permitted for unconsolidated statements, in addition to required national GAAP.

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Increased enforcement in 2008 Q1: "The Hungarian Financial Supervisory Authority (HFSA) is responsible for enforcing compliance with accounting standards. The HFSA set up a team dedicated to proactively reviewing financial statements at the beginning of 2008. No enforcement of compliance with accounting standards took place prior to that date. The first sanctions were imposed in the first half of 2009, and included: (i) restatements of financial statement information, and (ii) changes to financial statements going forward." (Christensen, Hail, and Leuz 2013)
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "In 2009 a new decree on documentation requirements (taking effect 2010)" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
The new size category 'micro' is introduced (next to small, medium, and large), for which disclosure exemption applies.
Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)

DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.
DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.
Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.
The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
Hungary reduced the corporate tax rate by 10 percentage points (from 19 to 9 percent).
IFRS required for unconsolidated statements of companies that are listed on EU-regulated markets. Early adoption in 2016 permitted.

"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 36 to 32 percent).
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 32 to 28 percent).
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 28 to 24 percent).
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 24 to 20 percent).
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 20 to 16 percent).
Ireland reduced the corporate tax rate by 3.5 percentage points (from 16 to 12.5 percent).

Introduced significant additional regulatory requirements for Irish companies, e.g. audit committees for certain companies. Establishment of the Irish Audit and Accounting Supervisory Authority (IAASA).

Local_language: E.C. (Abolition of Withholding Tax on Certain Interest + Royalties) Regulations 2003. SI n° 721 of 22/12/2003
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

Local_language: IFRS permitted for consolidated and unconsolidated statements.
Short Description: IFRS is permitted for private firms.

Local_language: S.I. No. 342 of 2005 Market Abuse (Directive 2003/6/EC) Regulations 2005
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Electronic Commerce Act, 2000 /// European Communities (Companies) Regulations 2004 /// European Communities (Companies)(Amendment) Regulations 2007
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Statutory Instrument No. 157 of 2008 EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES (CROSS-BORDER MERGERS) REGULATIONS 2008
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Local_language: Part 3 of No. 41 of 2006 Investment Funds, Companies and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2006 / Stautory Instrument No. 277 of 2007 TRANSPARENCY (DIRECTIVE 2004/109/EC) REGULATIONS 2007
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

Increased enforcement in 2007 Q3: "The Irish Audit and Accounting Supervisory Authority (IAASA) was incorporated in December 2005. However, it was not given the responsibility to enforce financial reporting regulations until June 2007. Beginning in the third quarter of 2007, the IAASA started to review half-yearly reports, and the first annual financial reports under the IAASA’s remit were those with a fiscal year beginning after January 20, 2007. No comments and review process existed before that date, and consequently no sanctions were imposed on firms prior to the shift. The first sanctions occurred in 2008 when the IAASA directed an issuer to restate its financial statements." (Christensen, Hail, and Leuz 2013)

Local_language: European Communities (Markets in Financial Instruments) Regulations 2007
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Local_language: STATUTORY INSTRUMENTS. S.I. No. 220 of 2010 EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES (STATUTORY AUDITS) (DIRECTIVE 2006/43/EC) REGULATIONS 2010
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: Finance Act 2007 /// SI No. 663 of 2006, and Finance Act 2007
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: SHAREHOLDERS’ RIGHTS (DIRECTIVE 2007/36/EC) REGULATIONS 2009, Statutory Instrument No. 316 of 2009
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Existence of documentation mitigates penalty effect" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: European Union (Administrative Cooperation in the field of taxation) Regulations 2012 /// European Union (Administrative Cooperation in the field of Taxation) Regulations 2012
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.
Irish GAAP was revised and several new standards were issued (e.g. FRS 100, 101 and 102).

The Irish Companies Act 2014 replaced several older Acts, bringing together many company law provisions into a single codified law. The Act sets out the legal obligations and duties of company directors, shareholders, auditors, as well as corporate governance. Section 275 of the Companies Act includes accounting standards.
DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: EUROPEAN UNION (STATUTORY AUDITS) (DIRECTIVE 2006/43/EC, AS AMENDED BY DIRECTIVE 2014/56/EU, AND REGULATION (EU) NO 537/2014) REGULATIONS 2016
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: S.I. No. 360 of 2017 - European Union (Disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large undertakings and Groups) Regulations 2017 /// Disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large undertakings and groups
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Section 25(1) of the Finance Act 2016 /// European Union (Administrative Cooperation in the Field of Taxation) (Amendment) Regulations 2016 /// FINANCE ACT 2016 (SECTION 25(1)) (COMMENCEMENT) ORDER 2016.
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.
DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: EUROPEAN UNION (MARKETS IN FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS) REGULATIONS 2017
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: DIRECTIVE (EU) 2017/828 OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 17 May 2017 amending Directive 2007/36/EC as regards the encouragement of long-term shareholder engagement
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: Finance Act 2018 /// COUNCIL DIRECTIVE (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2016 laying down rules against tax avoidance practices that directly affect the functioning of the internal market (as regards Article 4 Interest Limitation Rule) /// Finance Act 2021 - Act No. 45 of 2021
Short Description: The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

Local_language: Finance Act 2019 /// Finance Act 2021 - Act No. 45 of 2021
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Finance (No. 2) Act 2023 (see Part 6 of the Act – sections 94 and 95)
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: EUROPEAN UNION (DISCLOSURE OF INCOME TAX INFORMATION BY CERTAIN UNDERTAKINGS AND BRANCHES) REGULATIONS 2023
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.
