Introduction of a temporary investment credit. The credit could be carried forward up to five years and amounted to 50% of the investment in 1995 in excess of the average over the previous five years.
Italy reduced the corporate tax rate by 16.2 percentage points (from 53.2 to 37 percent).

Local_language: Decreto Legislativo del 24 febbraio 1998, n. 58 (Testo unico delle disposizioni in materia di intermediazione finanziaria)
English_translation: Legislative Decree No. 58 of Feb. 24, 1998 (Consolidated Law on Financial Intermediation)
Short Description: Major change in securities law, including increased minority shareholder rights and new rules on corporate governance.
Introduction of a flat-rate tax levied on the value added generated by all types of business activities
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.
Italy increased the corporate tax rate by 4.25 percentage points (from 37 to 41.25 percent).
Establishement of the Italian Accounting Committee OIC (Organismo Italiano di Contabilità or OIC)
Introduction of thin capitalization rules (limitation of tax deductibility of interest paid to shareholder). Replaced in 2008 by an interest barrier.

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2003/49/CE concernente il regime fiscale applicabile ai pagamenti di interessi e di canoni fra societa' consociate di Stati membri diversi.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2003/49/EC on the taxation of interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States.
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later. IFRS optional for unconsolidated (separate) financial statements of listed companies.

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2003/71/CE relativa al prospetto da pubblicare per l'offerta pubblica o l'ammissione alla negoziazione di strumenti finanziari, che modifica la direttiva 2001/34/CE.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2003/71/EC on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading, amending Directive 2001/34/EC.
Short Description: Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

IFRS permitted for non-financial unlisted private firms if financial statements are not abbreviated (consolidated and unconsolidated financial statements). IFRS adoption is mandatory for unlisted banks and financial institutions (both separated and consolidated financial statements) and mandatory for unlisted insurance companies (only for consolidated financial statements, but not allowed for unconsolidated financial statements).

After the Parmalat scandal in December 2003, the Italian Parliament enacted a major bankruptcy reform in 2005 which increased creditor rights. After 2005, the new bankruptcy code was amended multiple times.

Local_language: Abuso di informazioni privilegiate e alla manipolazione del mercato /// Modifiche ed integrazioni ai Decreti Legislativi 24 febbraio 1998, n.58, e 17 settembre 2007, n.164, in materia di intermediazione finanziaria e di mercati degli strumenti finanziari.
English_translation: Insider dealing and market manipulation /// Amendments and additions to Legislative Decrees No 58 of 24 February 1998 and No 164 of 17 September 2007 on financial intermediation and markets in financial instruments.
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Regolamento di attuazione dell'art. 8 della L. 29 dicembre 1993, n. 580, in materia di istituzione del registro delle imprese di cui all'art. 2188 del codice civile /// Conversione in legge, con modificazioni, del decreto-legge 31 gennaio 2007, n. 7, recante misure urgenti per la tutela dei consumatori, la promozione della concorrenza, lo sviluppo di attività economiche e la nascita di nuove imprese / Requisiti si pubblicità di taluni tipi di società
English_translation: Regulation implementing Article 8 of Law No 580 of 29 December 1993 on the establishment of the commercial register referred to in Article 2188 of the Civil Code /// Conversion into law, with amendments, of Decree-Law No 7 of 31 January 2007 laying down urgent measures to protect consumers, promote competition, develop economic activities and set up new businesses / Requirements for disclosure of certain types of companies
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.
IFRS was optional for separate financial statements of listed companies from 2005, and is required from 2006.

Local_language: DECRETO LEGISLATIVO 29 dicembre 2006, n. 303. Coordinamento con la legge 28 dicembre 2005, n. 262, del testo unico delle leggi in materia bancaria e creditizia (T.U.B.) e del testo unico delle disposizioni in materia di intermediazione finanziaria (T.U.F.).
English_translation: LEGISLATIVE DECREE 29 December 2006, n. 303. Coordination with the law of 28 December 2005, n. 262, of the consolidated text of the laws on banking and credit (T.U.B.) and of the consolidated text of the provisions on financial intermediation (T.U.F.).
Short Description: Presidential Decree D.P.R. 136/1975 introduced the "3+3+3" rule. After 3 years, the auditor could be re-appointed, for a maximum of 9 years. "The latest version of the rule (Legislative Decree 303/2006) drops the option to replace the incumbent auditor at the end of each three-year period. That is, once appointed, the auditor is retained for the maximum engagement period, i.e. nine years." (Cameran et al. 2016)

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2005/56/CE, relativa alle fusioni transfrontaliere delle società di capitali.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2005/56/EC on cross-border mergers of limited liability companies.
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers.
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

Local_language: Legge n.77/2007 Delega legislativa per il recepimento delle direttive 2004/39, 2002/98, 2002/15, 2004/25 /// Implementation of Directive 2004/25/EC on takeover bids.
English_translation: Law n.77/2007 Legislative delegation for the transposition of Directives 2004/39, 2002/98, 2002/15, 2004/25 /// Implementation of Directive 2004/25/EC on takeover bids
Short Description: The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2006/46/CE relativa ai conti annuali e ai conti consolidati delle banche, degli altri istituti finanziari e delle imprese di assicurazione.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2006/46/EC on the annual accounts and consolidated accounts of banks, other financial institutions and insurance undertakings
Short Description: Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Italy reduced the corporate tax rate by 5.85 percentage points (from 37.25 to 31.4 percent).

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2006/43/CE, relativa alle revisioni legali dei conti annuali e dei conti consolidati, che modifica le direttive 78/660/CEE e 83/349/CEE, e che abroga la direttiva 84/253/CEE.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2006/43/EC on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts, amending Directives 78/660/EEC and 83/349/EEC, and repealing Directive 84/253/EEC
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: Disposizioni per la formazione del bilancio annuale e pluriennale dello Stato (legge finanziaria 2008)
English_translation: Provisions for the formation of the annual and multi-year state budget (2008 Finance Law)
Short Description: Increased book-tax alignment, both for IFRS and Italian GAAP.
Introduction of interest barrier (limitation of tax deductions on interest expenses). It replaced the 2004 thin capitalization rule.

Local_language: Disposizioni per la formazione del bilancio annuale e pluriennale dello Stato (legge finanziaria 2008). /// Disposizioni per l'adempimento di obblighi derivati dall'appartenenza dell'Italia alle COmunità europee - Legge Comunitaria 2008
English_translation: Provisions for drawing up the State yearly and multi-annual budgets (Financial Law for 2008). /// Provisions for the fulfilment of obligations arising from Italy’s membership of the European Communities – 2008 Community Law
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

Local_language: Decreto Legislativo 6 novembre 2007, n. 195. Attuazione della direttiva 2004/109/CE sull'armonizzazione degli obblighi di trasparenza riguardanti le informazioni sugli emittenti i cui valori mobiliari sono ammessi alla negoziazione in un mercato regolamentato, e che modifica la direttiva 2001/34/C ///  Attuazione della direttiva 2004/109/CE sull'armonizzazione degli obblighi di trasparenza riguardanti le informazioni sugli emittenti i cui valori mobiliari sono ammessi alla negoziazione in un mercato regolamentato, e che modifica la direttiva 2001/34/CE.
English_translation: Legislative Decree No 195 of 6 November 2007. Implementation of Directive 2004/109/EC on the harmonisation of transparency requirements in relation to information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market and amending Directive 2001/34/EC /// Implementation of Directive 2004/109/EC on the harmonisation of transparency requirements in relation to information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market and amending Directive 2001/34/EC.
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

The Borsa Italina opens the market segment 'AIM Italia', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Appropriate documentation protects taxpayers from penalties for TP adjustments (penalty protection)." (Beer and Loeprick 2015)

Local_language: Obbligo di notifica alla Commissione Europea del recepimento dell'art. 10, par. 3. /// Attuazione della direttiva 2007/36/CE, relativa all'esercizio di alcuni diritti degli azionisti di società quotate
English_translation: Obligation to notify the European Commission of the transposition of Article 10 (3). /// Implementation of Directive 2007/36/EC on the exercise of certain rights of shareholders in listed companies
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
Allowance for Corporate Equity (ACE), also called Notional Interest, allows for a notional deduction for equity financing costs.
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 5 years to unlimited.

Local_language: Disposizioni comuni in materia di accertamento delle imposte sui redditi. /// Approvazione del testo unico delle imposte sui redditi. /// Attuazione della direttiva 2003/123/CE che modifica la direttiva 90/435/CEE sul regime fiscale comune applicabile alle società madri e figlie di Stati membri diversi.
English_translation: Common provisions on income tax assessment. /// Adoption of the consolidated text on income taxes. /// Implementation of Directive 2003/123/EC amending Directive 90/435/EEC on the common system of taxation applicable in the case of parent companies and subsidiaries of different Member States.
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2011/16/UE relativa alla cooperazione amministrativa nel settore fiscale e che abroga la direttiva 77/799/CEE. /// Recepimento della direttiva del Consiglio2011/16/UE del 16 febbraio 2011, che designa l'ufficio centrale di collegamento e i servizi di collegamento ai fini dell'attività di cooperazione amministrativa nel settore fiscale.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2011/16/EU on administrative cooperation in the field of taxation and repealing Directive 77/799/EEC. /// Transposition of Council Directive 2011/16/EU of 16 February 2011 designating the central liaison office and liaison services for the purpose of administrative cooperation in the field of taxation.
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2013/50/UE del Parlamento Europeo e del Consiglio, sull'armonizzazione degli obblighi di trasparenza riguardanti le informazioni sugli emittenti i cui valori mobiliari sono ammessi alla negoziazione in un mercato regolamentato, la direttiva 2003/71/CE del Parlamento europeo e del Consiglio, relativa al prospetto da pubblicare per l'offerta pubblica o l'ammissione alla negoziazione di strumenti finanziari e la direttiva 2007/14/CE della Commissione, che stabilisce le modalità di applicazione di talune disposizioni della direttiva 2004/109/CE.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2013/50/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the harmonisation of transparency requirements in relation to information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market, Directive 2003/71/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading and Commission Directive 2007/14/EC laying down detailed rules for the implementation of certain provisions of Directive 2004/109/EC.
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: DIRETTIVA 2014/56/UE DEL PARLAMENTO EUROPEO E DEL CONSIGLIO del 16 aprile 2014 che modifica la direttiva 2006/43/CE relativa alle revisioni legali dei conti annuali e dei conti consolidati
English_translation: Directive 2014/56/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 amending Directive 2006/43/EC on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: DECRETO LEGISLATIVO 30 dicembre 2016, n. 254:  Attuazione della direttiva 2014/95/UE del Parlamento Europeo e del Consiglio del 22.10.2014, recante modifiche alla direttiva 2013/34/UE per quanto riguarda la comunicazione di informazioni di carattere non finanziario e di informazioni sulla diversità da parte di talune imprese e di taluni gruppi di grandi dimensioni /// LEGGE 30 dicembre 2018, n. 145 "Bilancio di previsione dello Stato per l'anno finanziario 2019 e bilancio pluriennale per il triennio 2019-2021"
English_translation: Legislative Decree No. 254/2016: Implementation of Directive 2014/95/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 22.10.2014 amending Directive 2013/34/EU as regards disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large undertakings and groups /// Law No 145 of 30 December 2018 ‘Estimated State budget for the 2019 financial year and multiannual budget for the three-year period 2019-2021’
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Attuazione della legge 18 giugno 2015, n. 95 e della direttiva 2014/107/UE del Consiglio, del 9 dicembre 2014, recante modifica della direttiva 2011/16/UE per quanto riguarda lo scambio automatico obbligatorio di informazioni nel settore fiscale. /// ALLEGATO D (Previsto dall'articolo 1, comma 1, lettera b) - Elenco delle giurisdizioni partecipanti
English_translation: Implementation of Law No 95 of 18 June 2015 and Council Directive 2014/107/EU of 9 December 2014 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation. /// Annex D (Review from Article 1 (1) (b) – List of participating jurisdictions
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.
Italy reduced the corporate tax rate by 3.48635 percentage points (from 31.29275 to 27.8064 percent).

Local_language: Attuazione dell'articolo 1, commi 145 e 146 della legge 28/12/2015, n. 208 e della direttiva 2016/881/UE del Consiglio, del 25 maggio 2016, recante modifica della direttiva 2011/16/UE, per quanto riguarda lo scambio automatico obbligatorio di informazioni nel settore fiscale
English_translation: Implementation of Article 1 (145) and (146) of Law No 208 of 28/12/2015 and Council Directive (EU) 2016/881 of 25 May 2016 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva UE 2015/2376 recante modifica della direttiva 2011/16/UE per quanto riguarda lo scambio automatico obbligatorio di informazioni nel settore fiscale.
English_translation: Implementation of EU Directive 2015/2376 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation.
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Attuazione dell'articolo 1, commi 145 e 146 della legge 28/12/2015, n. 208 e della direttiva 2016/881/UE del Consiglio, del 25 maggio 2016, recante modifica della direttiva 2011/16/UE, per quanto riguarda lo scambio automatico obbligatorio di informazioni nel settore fiscale
English_translation: Implementation of Article 1 (145) and (146) of Law No 28/12/2015 and Council Directive (EU) 2016/881 of 25 May 2016 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2016/2258/UE del Consiglio, del 6.12.2016, recante modifica della direttiva 2011/16/UE del Consiglio, del 15.2.2011, per quanto riguarda l'accesso da parte delle autorità fiscali alle informazioni in materia di antiriciclaggio.
English_translation: Implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2016/2258 of 6.12.2016 amending Council Directive 2011/16/EU of 15.2.2011 as regards access by tax authorities to anti-money laundering information.
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Attuazione della Direttiva 2014/65/UE del Parlamento europeo e del Consiglio, del 15.5.2014, relativa ai mercati degli strumenti finanziari e che modifica la direttiva 2002/92/CE e la direttiva 2011/61/UE, così come modificata dalla direttiva 2016/1034/UE del Parlamento europeo e del Consiglio del 23.6.2016, e di adeguamento della normativa nazionali alle disposizioni del regolamento UE 2016/1033 del Parlamento europeo e del Consiglio del 23.6.2016.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2014/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15.5.2014 on markets in financial instruments and amending Directive 2002/92/EC and Directive 2011/61/EU, as amended by Directive (EU) 2016/1034 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23.6.2016, and adapting national legislation to the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/1033 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23.6.2016.
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva 2017/828 del Parlamento europeo e del Consiglio, del 17 maggio 2017, che modifica la direttiva 2007/36/CE per quanto riguarda l'incoraggiamento dell'impegno a lungo termine degli azionisti.
English_translation: Implementation of Directive 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2017 amending Directive 2007/36/EC as regards the encouragement of long-term shareholder engagement.
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: DECRETO LEGISLATIVO 29 novembre 2018, n. 142   - Attuazione della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 del Consiglio, del 12 luglio 2016, recante norme contro le pratiche di elusione fiscale che incidono direttamente sul funzionamento del mercato interno e come modificata dalla direttiva (UE) 2017/952 del Consiglio del 29 maggio 2017, recante modifica della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 relativamente ai disallineamenti da ibridi con i paesi terzi.
English_translation: Implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2016 laying down rules against tax avoidance practices that directly affect the functioning of the internal market and as amended by Council Directive (EU) 2017/952 of 29 May 2017 amending Directive (EU) 2016/1164 as regards hybrid mismatches with third countries.
Short Description: The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.

Local_language: Misure urgenti per il sostegno e il rilancio dell’economia
English_translation: Urgent measures to support and revive the economy
Short Description: Temporary changes in Italian GAAP to support corporations during Covid-19. Suspension of amortization charges and revaluation of fixed assets.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

"The Legislative Decree 14 of 2019 (the new law aiming at improving the early recognition of a crisis) redefined the companies that must audit their financial statements. In particular, the reference to ‘‘small entities’’ has been substituted with much lower thresholds, therefore increasing the number of companies that need the audit." (Gotti and Fasan, 2020)

Local_language: Attuazione della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 del Consiglio, del 12 luglio 2016, recante norme contro le pratiche di elusione fiscale che incidono direttamente sul funzionamento del mercato interno e come modificata dalla direttiva (UE) 2017/952 del Consiglio del 29 maggio 2017, recante modifica della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 relativamente ai disallineamenti da ibridi con i paesi terzi. /// Attuazione della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 del Consiglio, del 12 luglio 2016, recante norme contro le pratiche di elusione fiscale che incidono direttamente sul funzionamento del mercato interno e come modificata dalla direttiva (UE) 2017/952 del Consiglio del 29 maggio 2017, recante modifica della direttiva (UE) 2016/1164 relativamente ai disallineamenti da ibridi con i paesi terzi.
English_translation: Implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2016 laying down rules against tax avoidance practices that directly affect the functioning of the internal market and as amended by Council Directive (EU) 2017/952 of 29 May 2017 amending Directive (EU) 2016/1164 as regards hybrid mismatches with third countries. /// Implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2016 laying down rules against tax avoidance practices that directly affect the functioning of the internal market and as amended by Council Directive (EU) 2017/952 of 29 May 2017 amending Directive (EU) 2016/1164 as regards hybrid mismatches with third countries.
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Pubblicazione, nella Gazzetta Ufficiale n. 301 del 28 dicembre 2023, del decreto legislativo 27 dicembre 2023, n. 209, di recepimento nell’ordinamento italiano della Direttiva 2022/2523.
English_translation: Publication in Official Gazette No 301 of 28 December 2023 of Legislative Decree No 209 of 27 December 2023 transposing Directive 2022/2523 into Italian law.
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standand with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
The Latvian Accounting Standards were introduced.
Latvia reduced the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 25 to 22 percent).
Latvia reduced the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 22 to 19 percent).
Joined the European Union on May 1st, 2004
Latvia reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 19 to 15 percent).
Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.

English_translation: Amendments to the Financial Instrument Market Law
Short Description: Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
IFRS is permitted for consolidated financial statements.

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Local_language: Grozījumi Kredītiestāžu likumā /// Grozījumi Finanšu instrumentu tirgus likumā
English_translation: Amendments to the Law on Credit Institutions /// Amendments to the Financial Instrument Market Law
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Iekšējās kontroles sistēmas izveides noteikumi /// Grozījumi Finanšu instrumentu tirgus likumā /// Ieguldījumu pārvaldes sabiedrību pārskatu sagatavošanas normatīvie noteikumi
English_translation: Regulations regarding the Establishment of an Internal Control System /// Amendments to the Financial Instrument Market Law /// Regulatory provisions on the preparation of the accounts of investment management companies
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 5 to 6 years.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
The merger directive prescribes the possibility for enterprises to conduct cross-border mergers in the Union without adverse tax effects.
The new size category 'micro' is introduced (next to small, medium, and large), for which disclosure exemption applies.
Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

English_translation: Law on Taxes and Duties /// Cabinet Regulation No 20 of 5 January 2016 “Procedures for the execution by a financial institution of due diligence procedures for financial accounts and for providing information on financial accounts to the State Revenue Service”
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

English_translation: /// Cabinet Regulation No 397 of 4 July 2017 on the country-by-country report of a multinational enterprise group /// Cabinet Regulation No 397 of 4 July 2017 on the country-by-country report of a multinational enterprise group
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Ministru kabineta 2016.gada 20.decembra noteikumi Nr.864 "Grozījumi Ministru kabineta 2013. gada 5. novembra noteikumos Nr. 1245 "Kārtība, kādā tiek veikta informācijas apmaiņa nodokļu jomā starp Latvijas un citu Eiropas Savienības dalībvalstu kompetentajām iestādēm un ārvalstu kompetentajām iestādēm, ar kurām ir noslēgti Latvijas Republikas Saeimas apstiprināti starptautiskie līgumi""
English_translation: Cabinet Regulation No 864 of 20 December 2016 amending Cabinet Regulation No 1245 of 5 November 2013 on the procedure for exchanging information in the field of taxation between the competent authorities of Latvia and other Member States of the European Union and foreign competent authorities with which international agreements approved by the Saeima have been concluded

The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law

Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law

From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. English_translation: Law on joint-stock companies of the Republic of Lithuania
Short Description: Every company must have at least one auditor.

(Christensen et al. 2016)
Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers

Increased enforcement in 2007 Q4: "The Securities Commission of the Republic of Lithuania (LSC) was set up in February 2007, but did not institute a comment and review process until November 2007. Prior to 2007, Lithuania did have a formal enforcement regime, but no major enforcement actions were taken. The first sanctions under the new regime were imposed in 2008, and included: (i) public disclosure of violations, and (ii) restatements of financial statement information." (Christensen, Hail, and Leuz 2013)

Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." “IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). (ifrs.org)
