Local_language: INCOME TAX ACT(CAP. 123), European Union Anti-Tax Avoidance Directives Implementation (Amendment) Regulations, 2019 /// INCOME TAX ACT(CAP. 123), European Union Anti-Tax Avoidance Directives Implementation (Amendment) Regulations, 2020
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

Local_language: European Union Global Minimum Level of Taxation for Multinational Enterprise Groups and Large-Scale Domestic Groups Regulations, 2024
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Change in transfer pricing rules.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.
The Dutch Accounting Standards Board ('Raad voor de Jaarverslaggeving') issued new reporting guidelines.
Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Art 8b. of the Dutch Corporate Income Tax Act (DCITA)" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
The Council for annual reporting issued new reporting guidelines.
Code of conduct for Dutch firms which should be followed in their annual report

Local_language: Wijziging van enkele belastingwetten in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn 2003/49/EG van de Raad van de Europese Unie van 3 juni 2003 betreffende de gemeenschappelijke belastingregeling inzake uitkeringen van interest en royalty's tussen verbonden ondernemingen van verschillende lidstaten
English_translation: Amendment of some tax laws in connection with the implementation of Council Directive 2003/49/EC of the European Union of June 3, 2003 on the common system of taxation applicable to interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later. The Netherlands bundled the IFRS introduction with an increase in enforcement.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
The Netherlands reduced the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 34.5 to 31.5 percent).

The New York Stock Exchange opens the market segment 'Alternext Amsterdam', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards.
IFRS permitted for consolidated and unconsolidated financial statements.

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Wet van 14 december 2005 tot wijziging van de Handelsregisterwet 1996 ter uitvoering van richtlijn nr. 2003/58/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 15 juli 2003 (PbEG L 221) tot wijziging van richtlijn nr. 68/151/EEG van de Raad met betrekking tot de openbaarmakingsvereisten voor bepaalde soorten ondernemingen /// Besluit van 22 december 2005 tot wijziging van het Handelsregisterbesluit 1996 en het Besluit modellen jaarrekening in verband met uitvoering van richtlijn 2003/58/EG van Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 15 juli 2003 (PbEG L 221) tot wijziging van richtlijn 68/151/EEG van de Raad met betrekking tot de openbaarmakingsvereisten voor bepaalde soorten ondernemingen /// Besluit van 22 december 2005, houdende vaststelling van het tijdstip van inwerkingtreding van de Wet van 14 december 2005 tot wijziging van de Handelsregisterwet 1996 ter uitvoering van richtlijn nr. 2003/58/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 15 juli 2003 (PbEG L 221) tot wijziging van richtlijn nr. 68/151/EEG van de Raad met betrekking tot de openbaarmakingsvereisten voor bepaalde soorten ondernemingen (Stb. 2005, 727)
English_translation: Law of 14 December 2005 amending the The Trade Register Act 1996 for the implementation of Directive 2003/58/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union of 15 July 2003 (OJ L 221) amending Council Directive 68/151/EEC with on the disclosure requirements for certain types of undertakings /// Decree of 22 December 2005 amending the Trade Register Decree 1996 and the Decree models of financial statements related to implementation of Directive 2003/58/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union of 15 July 2003 (OJ L 221) amending the Directive Council Directive 68/151/EEC on the disclosure requirements for certain types of companies /// Decree of 22 December 2005 on determination of the time of entry into force of the Law of 14 December 2005 amending the Trade Register Act 1996 implementing Directive 2003/58/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union from 15 July 2003 (OJ L 221) to amendment of Directive 68/151/EEC of the Council with regard to the disclosure requirements for certain types of companies (Stb. 2005, 727)
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

Local_language: Wet van 27 juni 2008 tot wijziging van boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek in verband met de implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2005/56/EG van het Europese Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie betreffende grensoverschrijdende fusies van kapitaalvennootschappen (PbEU L 310)
English_translation: Law of 27 June 2008 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code in connection with the implementation of Directive 2005/56/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union on cross-border mergers of limited liability companies (PbEU) L 310)
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
The Netherlands reduced the corporate tax rate by 4.1 percentage points (from 29.6 to 25.5 percent).
Tax loss carryforwards was reduced from unlimited to 9 years, and tax loss carryback was reduced from 3 years to 1 year.

Local_language: Wet van 30 oktober 2007 tot wijziging van de Wet op het financieel toezicht ter implementatie van richtlijn markten voor financiele instrumenten (Wet implementatie richtlijn markten voor financiele instrumenten) /// Besluit van 30 oktober 2007, houdende regels ter uitvoering van de Wet op het financieel toezicht met betrekking tot de toegang tot de Nederlandse financiële markten voor marktexploitanten en voor het exploiteren of beheren van een gereglementeerde markt en wijziging van enkele andere besluiten ter implementatie van de richtlijn markten voor financiële instrumenten (Besluit gereglementeerde markten Wft) /// Besluit van 30 oktober 2007, houdende vaststelling van het tijdstip van inwerkingtreding van de Wet implementatie richtlijn markten voor financiële instrumenten en houdende het tijdstip van inwerkingtreding van het Besluit gereglementeerde markten Wft
English_translation: Act of 30 October 2007 amending the Financial Supervision Act to implement the Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (Act on Implementation of the Markets in Financial Instruments Directive) /// Decree of 30 October 2007 laying down rules implementing the Financial Act monitoring of access to the Dutch financial markets for market operators and for operating or managing a regulated market and amendment of a number of other acts implementation of the Markets Directive financial instruments (Decree regulated markets Wft) /// Decree of 30 October 2007 laying down: determination of the time of entry into force of the Implementation Act Directive on markets in financial instruments and the date of entry into force of the Decree on regulated markets Wft
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Besluit van 11 oktober 2006 tot verhoging van de grensbedragen, genoemd in de artikelen 396 lid 1 en 397 lid 1 van boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek ter uitvoering van richtlijn 2006/46/EG van het Europees parlement en de Raad van 14 juni 2006 (PbEU L 224) /// Wet van 11 december 2008 tot wijziging van boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek ter uitvoering van Richtlijn 2006/46/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 14 juni 2006, tot wijziging van de Richtlijnen 78/660/EEG, 83/349/EEG, 86/635/EEG en 91/674/EEG betreffende de jaarrekening en de geconsolideerde jaarrekening (PbEU L 224) /// Besluit van 20 maart 2009 tot wijziging van het Besluit van 23 december 2004 tot vaststelling van nadere voorschriften omtrent de inhoud van het jaarverslag, ter uitvoering van Richtlijn 2006/46/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 14 juni 2006, tot wijziging van de Richtlijnen 78/660/EEG, 83/349/EEG, 86/635/EEG en 91/674/EEG betreffende de jaarrekening en de geconsolideerde jaarrekening (PbEU L 224)
English_translation: Decree of 11 October 2006 increasing the limits referred to in Articles 396 (1) and 397 (1) of Book 2 of the Civil Code implementing Directive 2006/46/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2006 (OJ L 224) /// Law of 11 December 2008 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code implementation of Directive 2006/46/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2006, amending Directives 78/660/EEC, 83/349/EEC, 86/635/EEC and 91/674/EEC on the annual accounts and consolidated accounts (OJ L 224) /// Decree of 20 March 2009 amending the Decree of 23 December 2004 laying down detailed rules on the content of the annual report, implementing Directive 2006/46/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2006, amending Directives 78/660/EEC, 83/349/EEC, 86/635/EEC and 91/674/EEC on annual and consolidated accounts (OJ L 224)
Short Description: Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Local_language: Wet van 12 juni 2008, houdende wijziging van de Wet toezicht accountantsorganisaties en Boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek, ter implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2006/43/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 17 mei 2006 betreffende de wettelijke controles van jaarrekeningen en geconsolideerde jaarrekeningen, tot wijziging van de Richtlijnen 78/660/EEG en 83/349/EEG van de Raad, en houdende intrekking van Richtlijn 84/253/EEG van de Raad (PbEU L 157) ///  Besluit van 23 juni 2008 tot wijziging van het Besluit toezicht accountantsorganisaties en inwerkingtreding van de wet van 12 juni 2008 houdende wijziging van de Wet toezicht accountantsorganisaties en Boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek, ter implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2006/43/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 17 mei 2006 betreffende de wettelijke controles van jaarrekeningen en geconsolideerde jaarrekeningen, tot wijziging van de Richtlijnen 78/660/EEG en 83/349/EEG van de Raad, en houdende intrekking van Richtlijn 84/253/EEG van de Raad (PbEU L 157) /// Besluit van 26 juli 2008 tot uitvoering van artikel 41 van Richtlijn nr. 2006/43/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 17 mei 2006 betreffende de wettelijke controles van jaarrekeningen en geconsolideerde jaarrekeningen, tot wijziging van de Richtlijnen nr. 78/660/EEG en nr. 83/349/EEG van de Raad van de Europese Gemeenschappen en houdende intrekking van Richtlijn nr. 84/253/EEG van de Raad van de Europese Gemeenschappen
English_translation: Law of 12 June 2008 amending the Act on the Supervision of Accountancy Organisations and Book 2 of the Civil Code, implementation of Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union of 17 May 2006 on the statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts, amending Council Directives 78/660/EEC and 83/349/EEC of the Council, and repealing Council Directive 84/253/EEC (OJ L 157) /// Decree of 23 June 2008 amending the Decree on the supervision of audit organisations and entry into force of the Law of 12 June 2008 amending the Monitoring Act accounting organisations and Book 2 of the Civil Code, implementing Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union of 17 May 2006 on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts annual accounts, amending the Directives Council 78/660/EEC and 83/349/EEC, and repealing Directive 84/253/EEC of the Council (OJ L 157) /// Decree of 26 July 2008 implementing Article 41 of Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2006 on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts, amending Directives No 78/660/EEC and No 83/349/EEC of the Council of the European Communities and repealing Council Directive 84/253/EEC of the European Communities
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: Wet van 2 oktober 2003 tot wijziging van de Wet op de Omzetbelasting 1968 in verband met de - in beginsel tijdelijke - invoering van een omzetbelastingregeling voor elektronische diensten (e-commerce) /// Wet van 15 november 2007 tot wijziging van de Wet op de omzetbelasting 1968 in verband met richtlijn nr. 2006/112/EG van de Raad van de Europese Unie van 28 november 2006 betreffende het gemeenschappelijke stelsel van belasting over de toegevoegde waarde (PbEU L 347) (aanpassing aan de BTW-richtlijn 2006) /// Regeling van de Staatssecretaris van Financiën van 30 december 2015, nr. DB/2015/465M, tot wijziging van enige uitvoeringsregelingen inzake de fiscaliteit, toeslagen en douane alsmede van de Wet op de accijns
English_translation: Act of 2 October 2003 amending the 1968 Turnover Tax Act in connection with the introduction, in principle temporary, of a turnover tax scheme for electronic services (e-commerce) /// Law of 15 November 2007 amending the The 1968 Turnover Tax Act in relation to Council Directive 2006/112/EC of the European Union of 28 November 2006 on the common system of value added tax (OJEU) L 347) (alignment with the 2006 VAT Directive) /// Regulation of the State Secretary for Finance of 30 December 2015, No DB/2015/465M, amending certain implementing regulations on taxation, surcharges and customs and the Excise Act
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

Local_language: Wet van 25 september 2008 tot wijziging van de Wet op het financieel toezicht en enige andere wetten ter implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2004/109/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 15 december 2004 betreffende de transparantievereisten die gelden voor informatie over uitgevende instellingen waarvan effecten tot de handel op een gereglementeerde markt zijn toegelaten en tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2001/34/EG (PbEU L 390)
English_translation: Law of 25 September 2008 amending the Law on Financial Supervision and any other laws implementing the Directive no 2004/109/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union of 15 December 2004 on the transparency requirements which apply to information on issues institutions with trading effects on a regulated market is admitted and amending Directive 2001/34/EC (OJEU) L 390)
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

Local_language: Regeling 10 December 2008 nr. DB 2008/697M, Staatscourant 2008, nr. 246)
Short Description: Temporary (2009-2011) discretion to depreciate new assets up to 50% for tax purposes

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Wet van 30 juni 2010 tot wijziging van boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek en de Wet op het financieel toezicht ter uitvoering van richtlijn nr. 2007/36/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 11 juli 2007 betreffende de uitoefening van bepaalde rechten van aandeelhouders in beursgenoteerde vennootschappen (PbEU L 184) /// Besluit van 30 juni 2010 tot vaststelling van het tijdstip van inwerkingtreding van de wet van 30 juni 2010 tot wijziging van boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek en de Wet op het financieel toezicht ter uitvoering van richtlijn nr. 2007/36/EG van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 11 juli 2007 betreffende de uitoefening van bepaalde rechten van aandeelhouders in beursgenoteerde vennootschappen (PbEU L 184)
English_translation: Act of 30 June 2010 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code and the Financial Supervision Act implementing Directive 2007/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 July 2007 on the exercise of certain rights of shareholders in listed companies (OJ L 184) /// Decree of 30 June 2010 fixing the date of entry into force of the Act of 30 June 2010 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code and the Financial Supervision Act implementing Directive 2007/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 July 2007 on the exercise of certain rights of shareholders in listed companies (OJ L 184)
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Local_language: Bekendmaking implementatie richtlijn nr. 2011/96/EU van de Raad van 30 november 2011 betreffende de gemeenschappelijke fiscale regeling voor moedermaatschappijen en dochterondernemingen uit verschillende lidstaten (herschikking) (PB L 345/8)
English_translation: Publication on the implementation of Council Directive 2011/96/EU of 30 November 2011 on the common system of taxation applicable in the case of parent companies and subsidiaries of different Member States (recast) (OJ L 345/8)
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Wet van 27 september 2012 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen
English_translation: Law of September 27, 2012 amending the Law on International Assistance in Taxation
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).
The market segment 'Alternext Amsterdam' is closed.

Paper: Woudenberg, van der Hel - van Dijk, Kamerling 2021
English_translation: Additions to reporting on a complete set of financial statements for general purposes of a public-interest entity
Short Description: Extended auditor's report for Dutch public interest entities.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: Wijziging van de Wet toezicht accountantsorganisaties, het Burgerlijk Wetboek en enige andere wetten ter implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2014/56/EU van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 16 april 2014 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2006/43/EG betreffende de wettelijke controles van jaarrekeningen (PbEU 2014, L 158) en ter implementatie van verordening (EU) nr. 537/2014 van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 16 april 2014 betreffende specifieke eisen voor de wettelijke controles van financiële overzichten van organisaties van openbaar belang (PbEU 2014, L 158) (Implementatiewet wijzigingsrichtlijn en verordening wettelijke controles jaarrekeningen) /// Besluit van 8 december 2016 tot wijziging van het Besluit toezicht accountantsorganisaties en enige andere besluiten ter implementatie van richtlijn nr. 2014/56/EU van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van de Europese Unie van 16 april 2014 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2006/43/EG betreffende de wettelijke controles van jaarrekeningen en geconsolideerde jaarrekeningen (PbEU 2014, L 158) en ter implementatie van verordening (EU) nr. 537/2014 van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 16 april 2014 betreffende specifieke eisen voor de wettelijke controles van financiële overzichten van organisaties van openbaar belang (PbEU 2014, L 158).
English_translation: Amendment to the Accounting Supervision Act, the Civil Code and any other laws implementing Directive 2014/56/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of the European Union of 16 April 2014 amending Directive 2006/43/EC on statutory audits of annual accounts (OJ L 158, 2014) and implementing Regulation (EU) No 537/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on specific requirements regarding statutory audit of public-interest entities (OJ L 2014, 158) (Implementation Act Amending Directive and Statutory Audit Regulation) /// Decree of 8 December 2016 amending the Decree on the supervision of audit organisations and certain other acts implementing Directive 2014/56/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 amending Directive 2006/43/EC on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts (OJ L 158, 2014) and implementing Regulation (EU) No 537/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on specific requirements regarding statutory audit of public-interest entities (OJ L 158, 2014).
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.
The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.

Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services. In the Netherlands, extended auditor's reports were already mandatory since December 2014.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Wet van 23 december 2015 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen en de Belastingwet BES in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn 2014/107/EU van de Raad van 9 december 2014 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2011/16/EU wat betreft verplichte automatische uitwisseling van inlichtingen op belastinggebied (PbEU 2014, L 359) en om uitvoering te geven aan de door de OESO ontwikkelde Common Reporting Standard (Wet uitvoering Common Reporting Standard)
English_translation: Act of December 23, 2015 amending the Act on International Assistance in Taxation and the BES Tax Act in connection with the implementation of Council Directive 2014/107/EU of December 9, 2014 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards compulsory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation (OJEU 2014, L 359) and to give effect to the Common Reporting Standard developed by the OECD (Common Reporting Standard Implementation Act)
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen in verband met de automatische uitwisseling van inlichtingen over grensoverschrijdende rulings en verrekenprijsafspraken (Wet uitwisseling inlichtingen over rulings)
English_translation: Amendment to the International Tax Assistance Act in connection with the automatic exchange of information on cross-border rulings and transfer pricing agreements (Exchange of Information on Rulings Act)
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Wet van 29 mei 2017 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen en de Wet op de vennootschapsbelasting 1969 houdende aanvullende regels in verband met de automatische uitwisseling van inlichtingen met betrekking tot landenrapporten (Wet aanvullende regels uitwisseling landenrapporten)
English_translation: Act of 29 May 2017 amending the Act on International Assistance in Taxation and the Enterprise Income Tax Act 1969 on Supplementary Rules Relating to Automatic Exchange of Information in relation to Country Reports (Supplementary Rules on Exchange of Country Reports Act)
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Wet van 29 mei 2017 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen en de Wet op de vennootschapsbelasting 1969 houdende aanvullende regels in verband met de automatische uitwisseling van inlichtingen met betrekking tot landenrapporten (Wet aanvullende regels uitwisseling landenrapporten)
English_translation: Act of May 29, 2017 amending the International Tax Assistance Act and the Corporation Tax Act 1969 containing additional rules in connection with the automatic exchange of information regarding country reports (Additional Rules for Exchange of Country Reports Act)
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Wet van 4 december 2017 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn (EU) 2016/2258 van de Raad van 6 december 2016 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2011/16/EU wat betreft toegang tot antiwitwasinlichtingen door belastingautoriteiten (PbEU 2016, L 342) (Wet implementatie EU-richtlijn toegang belastingautoriteiten tot antiwitwasinlichtingen)
English_translation:
Act of December 4, 2017 amending the
Law on International Assistance in
Collection of Taxes in connection with the
implementation of Directive (EU) 2016/2258 of
Council of 6 December 2016 amending
Directive 2011/16/EU as regards access to
anti-money laundering information by
tax authorities (OJEU 2016, L 342) (Wet
Implementation of EU Directive Access
tax authorities to anti-money laundering information)
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Wet van 6 november 2019 tot wijziging van Boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek, de Wet op het financieel toezicht en de Wet giraal effectenverkeer ter uitvoering van richtlijn 2017/828/EU van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 17 mei 2017 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2007/36/EG wat het bevorderen van de langetermijnbetrokkenheid van aandeelhouders betreft (PbEU 2017, L 132) /// Besluit van 25 november 2019 tot vaststelling van het tijdstip van inwerkingtreding van de Wet van 6 november 2019 tot wijziging van Boek 2 van het Burgerlijk Wetboek, de Wet op het financieel toezicht en de Wet giraal effectenverkeer ter uitvoering van Richtlijn 2017/828/EU van het Europees Parlement en de Raad van 17 mei 2017 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2007/36/EG wat het bevorderen van de langetermijnbetrokkenheid van aandeelhouders betreft (PbEU 2017, L 132) (Stb. 2019, 423)
English_translation: Act of 6 November 2019 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code, the Financial Supervision Act and the Securities Exchange Act in order to implement Directive (EU) 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2017 amending Directive 2007/36/EC as regards the promotion of long-term shareholder engagement (OJ L 132, 2017) /// Decree of 25 November 2019 fixing the date of entry into force of the Act of 6 November 2019 amending Book 2 of the Civil Code, the Financial Supervision Act and the Securities Exchange Act implementing Directive (EU) 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2017 amending Directive 2007/36/EC as regards the promotion of long-term shareholder engagement (OJ L 132, 2017) (Stb. 2019, 423)
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

Local_language: Wijziging Wet op de vennootschapsbelasting 1969 /// Wet van 19 december 2018 tot wijziging van de Wet op de vennootschapsbelasting 1969 en de Invorderingswet 1990 in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn (EU) 2016/1164 van de Raad van 12 juli 2016 tot vaststelling van regels ter bestrijding van belastingontwijkingspraktijken welke rechtstreeks van invloed zijn op de werking van de interne markt (PbEU 2016, L 234/26) (Wet implementatie eerste EU-richtlijn antibelastingontwijking)
English_translation: Amendment of the Corporation Tax Act 1969 /// Act of 19 December 2018 amending the Corporation Tax Act 1969 and the Collection Act 1990 in connection with the implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2016 laying down rules against tax avoidance practices directly affecting the functioning of the internal market (OJ L 234/26, 2016) (Act implementing first EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive)
Short Description: The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Wet van 18 december 2019 tot wijziging van de Wet op de internationale bijstandsverlening bij de heffing van belastingen en de Algemene wet inzake rijksbelastingen in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn (EU) 2018/822 van de Raad van 25 mei 2018 tot wijziging van Richtlijn 2011/16/EU wat betreft verplichte automatische uitwisseling van inlichtingen op belastinggebied met betrekking tot meldingsplichtige grensoverschrijdende constructies (PbEU 2018, L 139) (Wet implementatie EU-richtlijn meldingsplichtige grensoverschrijdende constructies)
English_translation: Act of December 18, 2019 amending the Act on International Assistance in Taxation and the General Law on State Taxes in connection with the implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2018/822 of 25 May 2018 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation with respect to obligatory reporting of cross-border structures (OJEU 2018, L 139) (Act Implementing EU Directive on Obligatory Reporting of Cross-Border Structures)
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Wet van 18 december 2019 tot wijziging van de Wet op de vennootschapsbelasting 1969, de Wet inkomstenbelasting 2001 en de Wet op de dividendbelasting 1965 in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn (EU) 2017/952 van de Raad van 29 mei 2017 tot wijziging van Richtlijn (EU) 2016/1164 wat betreft hybridemismatches met derde landen (PbEU 2017, L 144/1) (Wet implementatie tweede EU-richtlijn antibelastingontwijking)
English_translation: Act of 18 December 2019 amending the Corporate Income Tax Act 1969, the Income Tax Act 2001 and the Dividend Tax Act 1965 in connection with the implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2017/952 of 29 May 2017 amending Directive (EU) 2016/1164 as regards hybrid mismatches with third countries (OJEU 2017, L 144/1) (Act Implementing the Second EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive)
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

Local_language: Wet van 20 december 2023 tot invoering van een minimumbelasting en wijziging van de Algemene wet inzake rijksbelastingen en de Invorderingswet 1990 in verband met de implementatie van Richtlijn (EU) 2022/2523 van de Raad van 14 december 2022 tot waarborging van een mondiaal minimumniveau van belastingheffing voor groepen van multinationale ondernemingen en omvangrijke binnenlandse groepen in de Unie (PbEU 2022, L 328/1)
English_translation: Act of 20 December 2023 introducing a minimum tax and amending the General State Tax Act and the Collection Act 1 990 in connection with the implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2022/2523 of 14 December 2022 on ensuring a global minimum level of taxation for multinational enterprise groups and large-scale domestic groups in the Union (OJ L 2022, 328/1)
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Implementatiewet Richtlijn openbaarmaking winstbelasting /// Implementatiebesluit Richtlijn openbaarmaking winstbelasting
English_translation: Implementing Act on the Disclosure of Income Tax Directive /// Implementing Decree on the Disclosure of Income Tax Directive
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 29 wrze´snia 1994 r. o rachunkowo´sci
Short Description: Major changes in local GAAP.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 13 pa´zdziernika 1994 r. o bieg ych re widentach i ich samorz dzie
Short Description: Change in audit requirements.
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 3 to 5 years.
Poland reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 34 to 30 percent).
A major change in local GAAP.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. " Broad requirement in Art. 9a of the Corporate Income Tax Law (CITL), since 2007 also applied to PE profit allocation; penalty effect (50 % penalty of income assessed for failure to submit doc)" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
The Polish Accounting Standards Committee (KSR) issues national accounting standards. The KSRs are based on IFRS, but they provide additional guidelines.
Joined the European Union on May 1st, 2004
Poland reduced the corporate tax rate by 8 percentage points (from 27 to 19 percent).

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 29 sierpnia 1997 - Ordynacja podatkowa /// Ustawa z 15 lutego 1992 o podatku dochodowym od osób prawnych /// Ustawa z dnia 20 kwietnia 2004 o zmianie ustawy o podatku dochodowym od osób fizycznych, ustawy o podatku dochodowym od osób prawnych oraz niektórych innych ustaw
English_translation: Act of 29 August 1997 – Tax Code /// Corporate Income Tax Act of 15 February 1992 /// Act of 20 April 2004 amending the Personal Income Tax Act, the Corporate Income Tax Act and certain other acts
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 25 kwietnia 2008 r. o zmianie ustawy - Kodeks spółek handlowych /// Ustawa z dnia 25 kwietnia 2008 r. o uczestnictwie pracowników w spółce powstałej w wyniku transgranicznego połączenia się spółek
English_translation: Act of 25 April 2008 amending the Commercial Companies Code /// Law of 25 April 2008 on employee participation in a company resulting from a cross-border merger
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 5 grudnia 2008r. o zmianie ustawy - Kodeks spółek handlowych oraz ustawy o obrocie instrumentami finansowymi
English_translation: Act of 5 December 2008 amending the Commercial Companies Code and the Trading in Financial Instruments Act
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.

Local_language: Member State does not consider the transposition necessary.
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 9 maja 2014 r. o ulatwienu dostepu do wykonywania niektorych zawodow reulowanych
English_translation: Act of the 9th May 2014 to facilitate access to perform certain regulated professions (Text No. 768).
Short Description: Deregulation in the accounting services sector.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 31 marca 2016 r. o zmianie ustawy o funduszach inwestycyjnych oraz niektórych innych ustaw /// Rozporządzenie Ministra Finansów z dnia 7 czerwca 2016 r. w sprawie wykazu instrumentów finansowych /// Rozporządzenie Ministra Finansów z dnia 25 maja 2016 r. zmieniające rozporządzenie w sprawie informacji bieżących i okresowych przekazywanych przez emitentów papierów wartościowych oraz warunków uznawania za równoważne informacji wymaganych przepisami prawa państwa niebędącego państwem członkowskim
English_translation: Act of 31 March 2016 amending the Investment Funds Act and certain other acts /// Regulation of the Minister for Finance of 7 June 2016 on the list of financial instruments /// Regulation of the Minister for Finance of 25 May 2016 amending the Regulation on current and periodic information to be provided by issuers of securities and the conditions for recognising as equivalent information required by the law of a non-Member State
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 9 marca 2017 r. o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami /// Ustawa z dnia 4 kwietnia 2019 r. o zmianie ustawy o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami oraz niektórych innych ustaw
English_translation: Act of 9 March 2017 on the exchange of tax information with other countries /// Act of 4 April 2019 amending the Act on the exchange of tax information with other countries and certain other acts
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 29 września 1994 r. o rachunkowości /// Ustawa z dnia 11 maja 2017 r. o biegłych rewidentach, firmach audytorskich oraz nadzorze publicznym
English_translation: Accounting Act of 29 September 1994 /// Act of 11 May 2017 on statutory auditors, audit firms and public oversight
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Rozporządzenie Ministra Finansów z dnia 25 maja 2016 r. zmieniające rozporządzenie w sprawie informacji bieżących i okresowych przekazywanych przez emitentów papierów wartościowych oraz warunków uznawania za równoważne informacji wymaganych przepisami prawa państwa niebędącego państwem członkowskim /// Ustawa z dnia 15 grudnia 2016 r. o zmianie ustawy o rachunkowości
English_translation: Regulation of the Minister for Finance of 25 May 2016 amending the Regulation on current and periodic information to be provided by issuers of securities and the conditions for considering information required by the law of a non-Member State to be equivalent /// Act of 15 December 2016 amending the Accounting Act
Short Description: The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 9 marca 2017 r. o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami /// Rozporządzenie Ministra Rozwoju i Finansów z dnia 13 czerwca 2017 r. w sprawie szczegółowego zakresu danych przekazywanych w informacji o grupie podmiotów oraz sposobu jej wypełniania /// Ustawa z dnia 4 kwietnia 2019 r. o zmianie ustawy o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami oraz niektórych innych ustaw
English_translation: Act of 9 March 2017 on the exchange of tax information with other countries /// Regulation of the Minister for Development and Finance of 13 June 2017 on the detailed scope of the data to be provided in the information on a group of entities and how it is to be completed /// Act of 4 April 2019 amending the Act on the Exchange of Tax Information with Other States and Certain Other Acts
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 9 marca 2017 r. o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami
English_translation: Act of 9 March 2017 on the exchange of tax information with other countries
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 9 marca 2017 r. o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami /// Rozporządzenie Ministra Rozwoju i Finansów z dnia 13 czerwca 2017 r. w sprawie szczegółowego zakresu danych przekazywanych w informacji o grupie podmiotów oraz sposobu jej wypełniania /// Ustawa z dnia 4 kwietnia 2019 r. o zmianie ustawy o wymianie informacji podatkowych z innymi państwami oraz niektórych innych ustaw
English_translation: Act of 9 March 2017 on the exchange of tax information with other countries /// Regulation of the Minister for Development and Finance of 13 June 2017 on the detailed scope of data to be provided in the information on a group of entities and the manner in which it is to be filled in /// Act of 4 April 2019 amending the Act on the exchange of tax information with other countries and certain other acts
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

(https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Ustawa z dnia 29 września 1994 r. o rachunkowości /// Ustawa z dnia 12 kwietnia 2024 r. o zmianie ustawy o rachunkowości oraz niektórych innych ustaw
English_translation: Accounting Act of 29 September 1994 /// Act of 12 April 2024 amending the Accounting Act and certain other acts
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Signed 'Treaty on European Union".
Euro area member since 1 January 1999.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Corporate Income Tax Code (CITC) Art. 63(6) and (7); penalty effect up to 100,000 Euro" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
Portugal reduced the corporate tax rate by 5.5 percentage points (from 33 to 27.5 percent).

Local_language: Transpõe para a ordem jurídica interna a Directiva n.º 2003/49/CE, do Conselho, de 3 de Junho, relativa a um regime fiscal comum aplicável aos pagamentos de juros e royalties efectuados entre sociedades associadas de Estados membros diferentes /// •Lei n.º 55/2013. D.R. n.º 152, Série I de 2013-08-08 Assembleia da República Completa a transposição da Diretiva n.º 2003/49/CE, do Conselho, de 3 de junho de 2003, relativa a um regime fiscal comum aplicável aos pagamentos de juros e royalties efetuados entre sociedades associadas de Estados membros diferentes, e altera o Código do Imposto sobre o Rendimento das Pessoas Coletivas, aprovado pelo Decreto-Lei n.º 442-B/88, de 30 de novembro
English_translation: Transposes into Portuguese law Council Directive 2003/49/EC of 3 June 2006 on a common system of taxation applicable to interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States /// Law No 55/2013. D.R. No 152, Series I, 2013-08-08 Assembly of the Republic It completes the transposition of Council Directive 2003/49/EC of 3 June 2003 on a common system of taxation applicable to interest and royalty payments made between associated companies of different Member States and amends the Corporate Income Tax Code, approved by Decree-Law No 442-B/88 of 30 November 2006.
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.

Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública-No uso das autorizações legislativas concedidas pelas Leis n.os 55/2005, de 18 de Novembro, e 56/2005, de 25 de Novembro, transpõe para a ordem jurídica nacional a Directiva n.º 2003/6/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 28 de Janeiro, relativa ao abuso de informação privilegiada e à manipulação de mercado, e a Directiva n.º 2003/71/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 4 de Novembro, relativa ao prospecto a publicar em caso de oferta pública de valores mobiliários ou da sua admissão à negociação /// Presidência do Conselho de Ministros-De ter sido rectificado o Decreto-Lei n.º 52/2006, do Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública, que, no uso das autorizações legislativas concedidas pelas Leis n.os 55/2005, de 18 de Novembro, e 56/2005, de 25 de Novembro, transpõe para a ordem jurídica nacional a Directiva n.º 2003/6/CE, do Parlamento e do Conselho, de 28 de Janeiro, relativa ao abuso de informação privilegiada e à manipulação de mercado, e a Directiva n.º 2003/71/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 4 de Novembro, relativa ao prospecto a publicar em caso de oferta pública de valores mobiliários ou da sua admissão à negociação.
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration In the use of legislative authorisations granted by Laws Nos 55/2005 of 18 November and 56/2005 of 25 November 2009, transposes into national law Directive 2003/6/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 28 January 2008 on insider dealing and market manipulation and Directive 2003/71/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 November 2009 on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading. /// The Presidency of the Council of Ministers De has amended Decree-Law No 52/2006 of the Ministry of Finance and Public Administration, which transposes into national law Directive 2003/6/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 28 January 2009 on insider dealing and market manipulation and Directive 2003/71/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 November 2009 on insider dealing and market manipulation and of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 November 2009 on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading.
Short Description: Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

The New York Stock Exchange opens the market segment 'Alternext Lisbon', in which EU regulations for EU-regulated public firms do not apply. Firms can choose to follow local GAAP or International Financial Reporting Standards. The market was renamed to 'Euronext Growth' on May 17, 2017.

Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública-Sétima alteração ao Código dos Valores Mobiliários, aprovado pelo Decreto-Lei n.º 486/99, de 13 de Novembro, que procede à transposição para a ordem jurídica nacional da Directiva n.º 2004/25/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 21 de Abril, relativa às ofertas públicas de aquisição, e primeira alteração ao regime jurídico da concorrência, aprovado pela Lei n.º 18/2003, de 11 de Junho.
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration – Seventh amendment to the Securities Code, approved by Decree-Law No 486/99 of 13 November 2006, transposing into national law Directive 2004/25/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2009 on takeover bids and the first amendment to the legal rules on competition, approved by Law No 18/2003 of 11 June 2009.
Short Description: The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Presidência do Conselho de Ministros-De ter sido rectificado o Decreto-Lei n.º 52/2006, do Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública, que, no uso das autorizações legislativas concedidas pelas Leis n.os 55/2005, de 18 de Novembro, e 56/2005, de 25 de Novembro, transpõe para a ordem jurídica nacional a Directiva n.º 2003/6/CE, do Parlamento e do Conselho, de 28 de Janeiro, relativa ao abuso de informação privilegiada e à manipulação de mercado, e a Directiva n.º 2003/71/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 4 de Novembro, relativa ao prospecto a publicar em caso de oferta pública de valores mobiliários ou da sua admissão à negociação. /// Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública-No uso das autorizações legislativas concedidas pelas Leis n.os 55/2005, de 18 de Novembro, e 56/2005, de 25 de Novembro, transpõe para a ordem jurídica nacional a Directiva n.º 2003/6/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 28 de Janeiro, relativa ao abuso de informação privilegiada e à manipulação de mercado, e a Directiva n.º 2003/71/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 4 de Novembro, relativa ao prospecto a publicar em caso de oferta pública de valores mobiliários ou da sua admissão à negociação.
English_translation: The Presidency of the Council of Ministers has been amended by Decree-Law No 52/2006 of the Ministry of Finance and Public Administration, which, using the legislative authorisations granted by Laws Nos 55/2005 of 18 November 2007 and 56/2005 of 25 November 2009, transposes into national law Directive 2003/6/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 28 January 2009 on insider dealing and market manipulation and Directive 2003/71/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 November 2009 on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading. /// Ministry of Finance and Public Administration – In the use of legislative authorisations granted by Laws Nos 55/2005 of 18 November 2006 and 56/2005 of 25 November 2009, transposes into national law Directive 2003/6/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 28 January 2006 on insider dealing and market manipulation and Directive 2003/71/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 November 2009 on the prospectus to be published when securities are offered to the public or admitted to trading.
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Ministérios das Finanças e da Administração Pública e da Justiça-Actualiza e flexibiliza os modelos de governo das sociedades anónimas, adopta medidas de simplificação e eliminação de actos e procedimentos notariais e registrais e aprova o novo regime jurídico da dissolução e da liquidação de entidades comerciais. /// Ministério da Justiça-Altera o regime jurídico da redução do capital social de entidades comerciais, eliminando a intervenção judicial obrigatória e promovendo a simplificação global do regime, cria a Informação Empresarial Simplificada (IES) e procede à alteração do Código das Sociedades Comerciais, do Código de Registo Comercial, do Decreto-Lei n.º 248/86, de 25 de Agosto, do Código de Processo Civil, do Regime Nacional de Pessoas Colectivas e do Regulamento Emolumentar dos Registos e do Notariado.
English_translation: Ministries of Finance, Public Administration and Justice - Updated and simplified corporate governance models, adopts measures to simplify and eliminate notarial and registrar acts and procedures and approves the new legal regime for the dissolution and liquidation of commercial entities. /// Ministry of Justice-amending the legal regime for reducing the share capital of commercial entities, eliminating compulsory judicial intervention and promoting the overall simplification of the scheme, creating the Simplified Business Information (IES) and amending the Commercial Companies Code, the Commercial Registration Code, Decree-Law No 248/86 of 25 August 2009, the Code of Civil Procedure, the National Legal Persons Regime and the Regulation on Registers and Notaries.
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.
IFRS is permitted for consolidated statements and for unconsolidated statements of group members that apply IFRS in their group statement.

Local_language: Assembleia da República Altera o Código das Sociedades Comerciais e o Código do Registo Comercial, transpondo para a ordem jurídica interna as Directivas n.os 2005/56/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 26 de Outubro, relativa às fusões transfronteiriças das sociedades de responsabilidade limitada, e 2007/63/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 13 de Novembro, que altera as Directivas n.os 78/855/CEE e 82/891/CEE, do Conselho, no que respeita à exigência de um relatório de peritos independentes aquando da fusão ou da cisão de sociedades anónimas, e estabelece o regime aplicável à participação dos trabalhadores na sociedade resultante da fusão
English_translation: Assembly of the Republic amends the Commercial Companies Code and the Commercial Register Code by transposing into national law Directives 2005/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 October 2006 on cross-border mergers of limited liability companies and 2007/63/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 November 2009 amending Council Directives 78/855/EEC and 82/891/EEC as regards the requirement for an independent expert report on the occasion of merger or division of public limited liability companies, and laying down the rules applicable to employee participation in the company resulting from the merger
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública-No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pela Lei n.º 25/2007, de 18 de Julho, altera o Regime Geral das Instituições de Crédito e Sociedades Financeiras, o Código dos Valores Mobiliários, o Código das Sociedades Comerciais, o regime jurídico das sociedades corretoras e financeiras de corretagem, o regime jurídico dos fundos de investimento imobiliário, o regime jurídico dos organismos de investimento colectivo, o Decreto-Lei n.º 176/95, de 26 de Julho, o Decreto-Lei n.º 94-B/98, de 17 de Abril, e o Decreto-Lei n.º 12/2006, de 20 de Janeiro, transpondo para a ordem jurídica interna a Directiva n.º 2004/39/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 21 de Abril de 2004, relativa aos mercados de instrumentos financeiros (DMIF), e as respectivas normas de execução constantes da Directiva n.º 2006/73/CE, da Comissão, de 10 de Agosto de 2006, que regula os requisitos em matéria de organização e as condições de exercício da actividade das empresas de investimento, bem como a Directiva n.º 2004/109/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 15 de Dezembro de 2004, relativa à harmonização dos requisitos de transparência no que se refere às informações respeitantes aos emitentes cujos valores mobiliários estão admitidos à negociação num mercado regulamentado (Directiva da Transparência), e as respectivas normas de execução constantes da Directiva n.º 2007/14/CE, da Comissão, de 8 de Março de 2007.
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration — In making use of the legislative authorisation granted by Law No 25/2007 of 18 July, it amends the General Regime for Credit Institutions and Financial Companies, the Securities Code, the Commercial Companies Code, the legal regime for brokerage and brokerage companies, the legal regime for real estate investment funds, the legal regime for collective investment undertakings, Decree-Law No 176/95 of 26 July, Decree-Law No 94-B/98 of 17 April and Decree-Law No 12/2006 of 20 January, transposing into Portuguese law Directive 2004/39/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on markets in financial instruments (MiFID), and its implementing rules contained in Commission Directive 2006/73/EC of 10 August 2006 regulating organisational requirements and operating conditions for investment firms, as well as Directive 2004/109/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15 December 2004 on the harmonisation of transparency requirements in relation to information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market (Transparency Directive) and its implementing rules contained in Commission Directive 2007/14/EC of 8 March 2007.
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
