Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública Transpõe para a ordem jurídica interna a Directiva n.º 2006/46/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 14 de Junho, que altera a Directiva n.º 78/660/CEE, do Conselho, relativa às contas anuais de certas formas de sociedades, a Directiva n.º 83/349/CEE, do Conselho, relativa às contas consolidadas, a Directiva n.º 86/635/CEE, do Conselho, relativa às contas anuais e às contas consolidadas dos bancos e outras instituições financeiras, e a Directiva n.º 91/674/CEE, do Conselho, relativa às contas anuais e às contas consolidadas das empresas de seguros, e adopta medidas de simplificação e eliminação de actos no âmbito de operações de fusão e cisão, alterando o Código de Registo Predial, o Código das Sociedades Comerciais, o Código de Registo Comercial, o Estatuto dos Benefícios Fiscais, o Código dos Valores Mobiliários, o Estatuto da Ordem dos Revisores Oficiais de Contas, o Regulamento Emolumentar dos Registos e do Notariado, o Código da Insolvência e da Recuperação de Empresas e o Regul
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration Ministry of Finance and Public Administration Transposes into national law Directive 2006/46/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2006 amending Council Directive 78/660/EEC on the annual accounts of certain types of companies, Council Directive 83/349/EEC on consolidated accounts, Council Directive 86/635/EEC on the annual accounts and consolidated accounts of banks and other financial institutions and Council Directive 91/674/EEC on the annual accounts and consolidated accounts of insurance undertakings and adopts measures for the simplification and elimination of acts in connection with mergers and divisions, amending the Real Estate Registration Code, the Commercial Companies Code, the Commercial Registration Code, the Tax Benefits Statute, the Securities Code, the Statute of the Association of Certified Accountants, the Regulation Emolument of Registers and Notaries, the Code on Insolvency and Business Recovery and the Regul
Short Description: Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.

Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública-No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pelo n.º 2 do artigo 1.º da Lei n.º 65-A/2007, de 26 de Novembro, altera o Código do IVA e o Regime do IVA nas Transacções Intracomunitárias, transpondo para a ordem jurídica interna as Directivas n.os 2006/69/CE, do Conselho, de 24 de Julho, e 2006/112/CE, do Conselho, de 28 de Novembro. /// Decreto-Lei n.º 71/2013. D.R. n.º 104, Série I de 2013-05-30 Ministério das Finanças No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pela Lei n.º 66-B/2012, de 31 de dezembro, aprova o regime de contabilidade de caixa em sede de Imposto sobre o Valor Acrescentado (regime de IVA de caixa), e altera o Código do IVA, aprovado pelo Decreto-Lei n.º 394-B/84, de 26 de dezembro
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration – In the exercise of the legislative authorisation granted by Article 1(2) of Law No 65-A/2007 of 26 November 2009, it amends the VAT Code and the VAT arrangements for intra-Community transactions, transposing into Portuguese law Council Directives 2006/69/EC of 24 July 2006 and 2006/112/EC of 28 November 2009. /// Decree-Law No 71/2013. D.R. No 104, Series I, 2013-05-30 Ministry of Finance In accordance with the legislative authorisation granted by Law No 66-B/2012 of 31 December 2006, it approves the cash accounting system for value added tax (cash VAT scheme) and amends the VAT Code, approved by Decree-Law No 394-B/84 of 26 December 2009.
Short Description: The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Ministério das Finanças e da Administração Pública Consagra a admissibilidade de acções sem valor nominal, reforça o regime de exercício de certos direitos de accionistas de sociedades cotadas e transpõe a Directiva n.º 2007/36/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 11 de Julho, e parcialmente a Directiva n.º 2006/123/CE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 12 de Dezembro /// Decreto-Lei n.º 27/2023, de 28 de abril, Diário da República n.º 83/2023, Série I de 2023-04-28, páginas 2 - 184, Aprova o regime da gestão de ativos
English_translation: Ministry of Finance and Public Administration Enshrines the admissibility of shares with no nominal value, strengthens the arrangements for exercising certain rights of shareholders in listed companies and transposes Directive 2007/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 July 2009 and partly Directive 2006/123/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 12 December 2009. /// Decree-Law No 27/2023 of 28 April, Diário da República No 83/2023, Series I of 2023-04-28, pages 2 – 184.
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
The previous code-law-based accounting system was replaced by a principal-based accounting system. The change included already increased comparability to the IFRS in line with Directive 2013/34/EU.
Tax loss carryforwards reduced from 6 years to 4 years.
Portugal increased the corporate tax rate by 3 percentage points (from 28.5 to 31.5 percent).

Local_language: Lei n.º 66-B/2012. D.R. n.º 252, Suplemento, Série I de 2012-12-31 Assembleia da República Orçamento do Estado para 2013
English_translation: Law 66-B/2012. D.R. No 252, Supplement, Series I, 2012-12-31 Assembly of the Republic State budget for 2013
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 4 years to 5 years.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Decreto-Lei n.º 61/2013. D.R. n.º 90, Série I de 2013-05-10 Ministério das Finanças No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pela Lei n.º 66-B/2012, de 31 de dezembro, transpõe a Diretiva n.º 2011/16/UE, do Conselho, de 15 de fevereiro de 2011, relativa à cooperação administrativa no domínio da fiscalidade e que revoga a Diretiva n.º 77/799/CEE, do Conselho, de 19 de dezembro de 1977 /// DECRETO-LEI N.º 61/2013 - DIÁRIO DA REPÚBLICA N.º 90/2013, SÉRIE I DE 2013-05-10 Ato da Série I Ministério das Finanças No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pela Lei n.º 66-B/2012, de 31 de dezembro, transpõe a Diretiva n.º 2011/16/UE, do Conselho, de 15 de fevereiro de 2011, relativa à cooperação administrativa no domínio da fiscalidade e que revoga a Diretiva n.º 77/799/CEE, do Conselho, de 19 de dezembro de 1977
English_translation: Decree-Law No 61/2013. D.R. No 90, Series I, 2013-05-10 The Ministry of Finance In accordance with the legislative authorisation granted by Law No 66-B/2012 of 31 December 2006, it transposes Council Directive 2011/16/EU of 15 February 2011 on administrative cooperation in the field of taxation and repealing Council Directive 77/799/EEC of 19 December 1977 /// DECREE-LAW NO 61/2013 – REPUBLIC GAZETTE NO 90/2013, SERIES I OF 2013-05-10 I Series Act The Ministry of Finance In accordance with the legislative authorisation granted by Law No 66-B/2012 of 31 December 2006, it transposes Council Directive 2011/16/EU of 15 February 2011 on administrative cooperation in the field of taxation and repealing Council Directive 77/799/EEC of 19 December 1977
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: DECRETO-LEI N.º 98/2015 - DIÁRIO DA REPÚBLICA N.º 106/2015, SÉRIE I DE 2015-06-02 Ministério das Finanças Transpõe a Diretiva n.º 2013/34/UE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 26 de junho de 2013, relativa às demonstrações financeiras anuais, às demonstrações financeiras consolidadas e aos relatórios conexos de certas formas de empresas /// Portaria n.º 220/2015 - Diário da República n.º 143/2015, Série I de 2015-07-24 Ato da Série I Ministério das Finanças Aprova os modelos de demonstrações financeiras para as diferentes entidades que aplicam o SNC /// Ministério das Finanças-Aprova o Código de Contas
English_translation: DECREE-LAW NO 98/2015 — OFFICIAL JOURNAL NO 106/2015, SERIES I OF 2015-06-02 Ministry of Finance Transposes Directive 2013/34/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 June 2013 on the annual financial statements, consolidated financial statements and related reports of certain types of undertakings /// Order No 220/2015 — Official Gazette No 143/2015, Series I, 2015-07-24 Act of Series I Ministry of Finance Approves the financial statement templates for the different entities applying the NCS /// Ministry of Finance — Approval of the Code of Accounts
Short Description: Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU. In Portugal, the main change in local GAAP was already in 2010 (Decree-Law No. 158/2009).

Local_language: LEI N.º 140/2015 - DIÁRIO DA REPÚBLICA N.º 174/2015, SÉRIE I DE 2015-09-0770202882 Assembleia da República Aprova o novo Estatuto da Ordem dos Revisores Oficiais de Contas, em conformidade com a Lei n.º 2/2013, de 10 de janeiro, que estabelece o regime jurídico de criação, organização e funcionamento das associações públicas profissionais /// LEI N.º 148/2015 - DIÁRIO DA REPÚBLICA N.º 176/2015, SÉRIE I DE 2015-09-09 Assembleia da República Aprova o Regime Jurídico da Supervisão de Auditoria, transpondo a Diretiva 2014/56/UE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 16 de abril de 2014, que altera a Diretiva 2006/43/CE relativa à revisão legal das contas anuais e consolidadas, e assegura a execução, na ordem jurídica interna, do Regulamento (UE) n.º 537/2014, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 16 de abril de 2014, relativo aos requisitos específicos para a revisão legal de contas das entidades de interesse público
English_translation: LAW NO 140/2015 — OFFICIAL GAZETTE NO 174/2015, SERIES I OF 2015-09-0770202882 Assembly of the Republic Approves the new Statute of the Chamber of Certified Accountants, in accordance with Law No 2/2013 of 10 January 2009 laying down the legal framework for the creation, organisation and operation of public professional associations. /// LAW NO 148/2015 — OFFICIAL GAZETTE NO 176/2015, SERIES I OF 2015-09-09 Assembly of the Republic Approves the Legal Framework for Auditing Oversight, transposing Directive 2014/56/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 amending Directive 2006/43/EC on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts and ensures the implementation in the internal legal system of Regulation (EU) No 537/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on specific requirements regarding statutory audit of public-interest entities
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.
The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: DECRETO-LEI N.º 64/2016 - DIÁRIO DA REPÚBLICA N.º 195/2016, SÉRIE I DE 2016-10-11 Finanças No uso da autorização legislativa concedida pelos n.os 1, 2 e 3 do artigo 188.º da Lei n.º 7-A/2016, de 30 de março, regula a troca automática de informações obrigatória no domínio da fiscalidade e prevê regras de comunicação e de diligência pelas instituições financeiras relativamente a contas financeiras, transpondo a Diretiva n.º 2014/107/UE, do Conselho, de 9 de dezembro de 2014, que altera a Diretiva n.º 2011/16/UE /// Lei nº 91/2017 de 22 de agosto - Modifica as condições em que um país, região ou território pode ser considerado regime fiscal claramente mais favorável, alterando a Lei Geral Tributária
English_translation: DECREE-LAW NO 64/2016 – REPUBLIC GAZETTE NO 195/2016, SERIES I OF 2016-10-11 Finances In the use of the legislative authorisation granted by Article 188 (1), (2) and (3) of Law No 7-A/2016 of 30 March, it regulates mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation and lays down rules on reporting and due diligence by financial institutions with regard to financial accounts, transposing Council Directive 2014/107/EU of 9 December 2014 amending Directive 2011/16/EU. /// Law No 91/2017 of 22 August 2009 – Modifies the conditions under which a country, region or territory can be regarded as a clearly more favourable tax regime by amending the General Tax Law
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.
Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.
DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Lei n.º 83/2017, de 18 de agosto que estabelece medidas de combate ao branqueamento de capitais e ao financiamento do terrorismo, transpõe parcialmente as Diretivas 2015/849/UE, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 20 de maio de 2015, e 2016/2258/UE, do Conselho, de 6 de dezembro de 2016, altera o Código Penal e o Código da Propriedade Industrial e revoga a Lei n.º 25/2008, de 5 de junho, e o Decreto-Lei n.º 125/2008, de 21 de julho
English_translation: Law No 83/2017 of 18 August laying down measures to combat money laundering and terrorist financing, partially transposes Directives (EU) 2015/849 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 May 2015 and (EU) 2016/2258 of 6 December 2016 amending the Criminal Code and the Industrial Property Code and repealing Law No 25/2008 of 5 June and Decree-Law No 125/2008 of 21 July 2009
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Transpõe a Diretiva (UE) n.º 2017/828 do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 17 de maio de 2017, relativa a direitos dos acionistas de sociedades cotadas no que concerne ao seu envolvimento a longo prazo, altera o Código dos Valores Mobiliários, o Regime Geral dos Organismos de Investimento Coletivo e o Regime Geral das Instituições de Crédito e Sociedades Financeiras, e revoga a Lei n.º 28/2009, de 19 de junho /// Lei n.º 50/2020 de 25 de agosto - Transpõe a Diretiva (UE) n.º 2017/828 do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 17 de maio de 2017, relativa a direitos dos acionistas de sociedades cotadas no que concerne ao seu envolvimento a longo prazo, altera o Código dos Valores Mobiliários, o Regime Geral dos Organismos de Investimento Coletivo e o Regime Geral das Instituições de Crédito e Sociedades Financeiras, e revoga a Lei n.º 28/2009, de 19 de junho
English_translation: Transposes Directive (EU) 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2017 on the rights of shareholders of listed companies with regard to their long-term involvement, amends the Securities Code, the General Rules for Collective Investment Undertakings and the General Rules for Credit Institutions and Financial Companies and repeals Law No 28/2009 of 19 June /// Law No 50/2020 of 25 August – transposes Directive (EU) 2017/828 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2017 on the rights of shareholders of listed companies with regard to their long-term involvement, amends the Securities Code, the General Rules for Collective Investment Undertakings and the General Rules for Credit Institutions and Financial Companies, and repeals Law No 28/2009 of 19 June.
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Lei n.º 26/2020 de 21 de julho - Estabelece a obrigação de comunicação à Autoridade Tributária e Aduaneira de determinados mecanismos internos ou transfronteiriços com relevância fiscal, transpondo a Diretiva (UE) 2018/822 do Conselho, de 25 de maio de 2018, e revogando o Decreto-Lei n.º 29/2008, de 25 de fevereiro
English_translation: Law No 26/2020 of 21 July – establishes the obligation to communicate to the Tax and Customs Authority certain internal or cross-border mechanisms with tax relevance, transposing Council Directive (EU) 2018/822 of 25 May 2018 and repealing Decree-Law No 29/2008 of 25 February 2009
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

Local_language: Lei n.º 32/2019 de 3 de maio - Reforça o combate às práticas de elisão fiscal, transpondo a Diretiva (UE) 2016/1164, do Conselho, de 16 de julho /// Lei n.º 24/2020 de 6 de julho - Altera o Código do Imposto sobre o Rendimento das Pessoas Coletivas, transpondo parcialmente a Diretiva (UE) 2016/1164 do Conselho, de 12 de julho, no que respeita às assimetrias híbridas /// Lei n.º 24/2020 de 6 de julho - Altera o Código do Imposto sobre o Rendimento das Pessoas Coletivas, transpondo parcialmente a Diretiva (UE) 2016/1164 do Conselho, de 12 de julho, no que respeita às assimetrias híbridas
English_translation: Law No 32/2019 of 3 May 2008 – Enforcing the fight against tax avoidance practices by transposing Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 16 July 2009 /// Law No 24/2020 of 6 July 2013 – Amendments to the Corporate Income Tax Code, partially transposing Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2009, as regards hybrid mismatches /// Law No 24/2020 of 6 July 2013 – Amendments to the Corporate Income Tax Code, partially transposing Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164 of 12 July 2009, as regards hybrid mismatches
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Local_language: Decreto-Lei n.º 73/2023, de 23 de agosto, Diário da República n.º 163/2023, Série I de 2023-08-23, páginas 46 - 53, Transpõe a Diretiva (UE) 2021/2101 no que respeita à divulgação de informações relativas ao imposto sobre o rendimento por determinadas empresas e sucursais
English_translation: Decree-Law No 73/2023 of 23 August, Official Gazette No 163/2023, Series I of 2023-08-23, pages 46 – 53, Transit Directive (EU) 2021/2101 as regards the disclosure of income tax information by certain undertakings and branches
Short Description: Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
New rules for the accounting profession
Romania reduced the corporate tax rate by 7 percentage points (from 45 to 38 percent).

"Obligation to verify and certify the balance sheet even for commercial companies lacking an auditor if the turnover is greater than lei 500 million annually. The balance sheets of these companies are verified and certified by public accountants (experti contabili) or by commercial companies with the configuration of Corporate Public Accountants and Authorized Accountants." (Dutia 1995)
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 2 to 3 years.
Tax loss carryforwards was increased from 3 to 5 years.

Milestones: New Romanian accounting and auditing laws
Short Description: Increased audit requirements: verification of consistency between annual reports and annual accounts is required.

Local_language: ORDIN nr. 403 din 22 aprilie 1999 pentru aprobarea Reglementărilor contabile armonizate cu Directiva a IV-a a Comunităţilor Economice Europene şi cu Standardele de Contabilitate Internaţionale
English_translation: ORDER no. 403 of April 22, 1999 for the approval of the Accounting Regulations harmonized with the IV Directive of the European Economic Communities and with the International Accounting Standards
Short Description: A sample of large Romanian entities (public interest entities) were asked to apply European Directives and the International Accounting Standards (IAS). The first volume transposed the European directives, and the second volume asked the sample entities to apply IAS. This created confusion on the pecking order of foreign regulations (ED or IAS), since the standards were not completely similar. This order initiated the gradual adoption of IAS/IFRS in Romania.
Romania reduced the corporate tax rate by 13 percentage points (from 38 to 25 percent).

Local_language: ORDIN nr. 94 din 29 ianuarie 2001, pentru aprobarea Reglementărilor contabile armonizate cu Directiva a IV-a a Comunităţilor Economice Europene şi cu Standardele Internaţionale de Contabilitate
English_translation: ORDER no. 94 of January 29, 2001, for the approval of the Accounting Regulations harmonized with the IV Directive of the European Economic Communities and with the International Accounting Standards
Short Description: Replaced nr. 403 of 22 April 1999. Now, around 1,700 large Romanian entities were asked to apply European Directives and the International Accounting Standards (IAS).

Local_language: Lege privind piaţa de capital /// Ordin al Comisiei Naţionale a Valorilor Mobiliare pentru aprobarea Regulamentului nr.1/2006 privind emitenţii şi operaţiunile cu valori mobiliare /// Legea nr. 24 /2017 privind emitenţii de instrumente financiare şi operaţiuni de piaţă
English_translation: Law on the capital market /// Order of the National Securities Commission approving Regulation nr.1/2006 on issuers and transactions in securities /// Law No 24/2017 on issuers of financial instruments and market operations
Short Description: Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
Romania reduced the corporate tax rate by 9 percentage points (from 25 to 16 percent).
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.

Local_language: Lege privind societăţile comerciale - republicată /// Hotărâre privind procedurile de informare, consultare şi alte modalităţi de implicare a angajaţilor în activitatea societăţii europene /// Ordonanţă de urgenţă pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr. 31/1990 privind societăţile comerciale şi pentru completarea Legii nr.26/1990 privind registrul comerţului
English_translation: Companies Act — republished /// Decision on information, consultation and other arrangements for the involvement of employees in the activity of the European company /// Emergency Order amending Law No 31/1990 on commercial companies and supplementing Law No nr.26/1990 on the Trade Register
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Joined the European Union.
IFRS permitted for private firms (consolidated statements).

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

"The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)

Local_language: Lege privind Codul fiscal /// Lege pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr.571/2006 privind Codul Fiscal
English_translation: Tax Code Act /// Law amending Law No nr.571/2006 on the Fiscal Code
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.

Local_language: Ordonanţa de urgenţă privind auditul statuar al situaţiilor financiare anuale şi al situaţiilor financiare anuale consolidate /// Lege pentru aprobarea Ordonanţei de urgenţă a Guvernului nr. 90/2008 privind auditul statutar al situaţiilor financiare anuale şi al situaţiilor financiare anuale consolidate /// Ordonanţa Guvernului pentru modificarea şi completarea Ordonanţei de urgenţă a Guvernului nr. 90/2008 privind auditul statutar al situaţiilor financiare anuale consolidate şi a Ordonanţei Guvernului nr. 65/1994 privind organizarea activităţii de expertiză contabilă şi a contabililor autorizaţi
English_translation: Emergency Ordinance on the statutory audit of annual accounts and consolidated annual accounts /// Law approving Government Emergency Order No 90/2008 on the statutory audit of annual accounts and consolidated annual accounts /// Government Order amending Government Emergency Order No 90/2008 on the statutory audit of consolidated annual accounts and Government Order No 65/1994 on the organisation of the activity of accounting expertise and authorised accountants
Short Description: Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 5 years to 7 years.
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
IFRS is required for all credit institutions (listed and unlisted).

Local_language: Ordinul 1286 din  1 octombrie 2012 pentru aprobarea Reglementărilor contabile conforme cu Standardele internaționale de raportare financiară, aplicabile societăților comerciale ale căror valori mobiliare sunt admise la tranzacționare pe o piață reglementată
English_translation: Order 1286 of October 1, 2012 for the approval of Accounting Regulations in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, applicable to commercial companies whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market
Short Description: IFRS is required for individual statements.

Local_language: Ordonanţă de urgenţă a Guvernului pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr. 571/2003 privind Codul fiscal şi reglementarea unor măsuri financiar-fiscale /// Ordonanţă de urgenţă pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr. 571/2003 privind Codul fiscal şi reglementarea unor măsuri financiar-fiscale /// Ordonanta Guvernului nr.8/2021 pentru modificarea si completarea Legii nr.227/2015 prvind Codul Fiscal
English_translation: Government Emergency Order amending Law No 571/2003 on the Fiscal Code and regulating certain financial-fiscal measures /// Emergency Order amending Law No 571/2003 on the Fiscal Code and regulating certain financial-fiscal measures /// Government Order No nr.8/2021 amending Law No nr.227/2015 on the Fiscal Code
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Ordonanţă pentru modificarea şi completarea Ordonanţei Guvernului nr.92/2003 privind Codul de procedură fiscală /// Lege privind aprobarea Ordonanţei Guvernului nr. 2/2012 pentru modificarea şi completarea Ordonanţei Guvernului nr.92/2003 privind Codul de procedură fiscală
English_translation: Order amending Government Order No nr.92/2003 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure /// Law approving Government Order No 2/2012 amending Government Order No nr.92/2003 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)
Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.

Local_language: Legea nr.24/2017 privind emitenții de instrumente financiare și operațiuni de piață
English_translation: Law nr.24/2017 on issuers of financial instruments and market operations
Short Description: The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.

Local_language: Legea nr.207/2015 privind Codul de procedură fiscală /// Ordonanță de urgență nr. 102/2022 pentru modificarea și completarea Legii nr. 207/2015 privind Codul de procedură fiscală
English_translation: Law No nr.207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure /// Emergency Order No 102/2022 amending Law No 207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure
Short Description: DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Legea nr. 162/2017 privind auditul statutar al situațiilor financiare anuale și al situațiilor financiare anuale consolidate și de modificare a unor acte normative
English_translation: Law No 162/2017 on the statutory audit of annual financial statements and consolidated annual financial statements and amending certain legislative acts
Short Description: Audit reform for public interest companies (PIE), including the introduction of mandatory audit firm rotation.
The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.

Local_language: Ordonanta de Urgenta 42/2017 pentru modificarea si completarea Legii nr.207/2015 privind Codul de procedura fiscala
English_translation: Emergency Order No 42/2017 amending Law No nr.207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure
Short Description: Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.

Local_language: Ordonanţă de urgenţă nr.84/2016 pentru modificarea şi completarea unor acte normative din domeniul financiar-fiscal.
English_translation: Emergency Ordinance nr.84/2016 amending and supplementing certain legislative acts in the field of financial and fiscal matters.
Short Description: DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.

Local_language: Ordonanta de Urgenta 42/2017 pentru modificarea si completarea Legii nr.207/2015 privind Codul de procedura fiscala
English_translation: Emergency Order No 42/2017 amending Law No nr.207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure
Short Description: DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Local_language: Legea nr.207/2015 privind Codul de Procedură Fiscală /// Ordonanţa de urgenţă nr.114/2018 privind instituirea unor măsuri în domeniul investiţiilor publice şi a unor măsuri fiscal-bugetare, modificarea şi completarea unor acte normative şi prorogarea unor termene /// Lege nr.129/2019 pentru prevenirea şi combaterea spălării banilor şi finanţării terorismului, precum şi pentru modificarea şi completarea unor acte normative
English_translation: Law nr.207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure /// Emergency Ordinance No nr.114/2018 establishing measures in the field of public investment and fiscal measures, amending and supplementing certain legislative acts and extending certain deadlines /// Law nr.129/2019 on preventing and combating money laundering and terrorist financing and amending and supplementing certain legislative acts
Short Description: DAC 5 prescribes the automatic exchange and access by relevant tax authorities on beneficial ownership under AML rules.

Milestones: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Local_language: IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
Short Description: "Applying IFRS 15, an entity recognises revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to the customer in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services." (ifrs.org)
"IFRS 9 specifies how an entity should classify and measure financial assets, financial liabilities, and some contracts to buy or sell non-financial items." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Lege nr.126/2018 privind pieţele de instrumente financiare
English_translation: Law nr.126/2018 on markets in financial instruments
Short Description: The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II), a financial services directive effective from 3 January 2018, requires "asset managers and broker-dealers to unbundle the cost of investment research and advisory services from the cost of trade execution" (Fang et al. 2020), which affects the information environment of firms by breaking the research analysts from the brokerage firms (i.e., it affects how analysts and banks advise clients). Together with the new Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation ('MiFIR' 600/2014/EU), MiFID II enhances investor protection and increases transparency, especially for non-equity instruments (e.g., bonds and derivatives). The new Directive affects not only listed firms but also non-listed firms, e.g., through M&A activities.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) specifies standards for data protection. Violations can include fines up to 4% of the worldwide turnover.

"The objective of IFRS 16 is to report information that (a) faithfully represents lease transactions and (b) provides a basis for users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. To meet that objective, a lessee should recognise assets and liabilities arising from a lease." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Lege nr.24/2017 privind emitenţii de instrumente financiare şi operaţiuni de piaţă /// Regulament nr.5/2018 al Autorităţii de Supraveghere Financiară privind emitenţii de instrumente financiare şi operaţiuni de piaţă /// Lege nr. 158/2020 pentru modificarea, completarea şi abrogarea unor acte normative, precum şi pentru stabilirea unor măsuri de punere în aplicare a Regulamentului (UE) 2017/2.402 al Parlamentului European şi al Consiliului din 12 decembrie 2017 de stabilire a unui cadru general privind securitizarea şi de creare a unui cadru specific pentru o securitizare simplă, transparentă şi standardizată şi de modificare a Directivelor 2009/65/CE, 2009/138/CE şi 2011/61/UE, precum şi a Regulamentelor (CE) nr. 1060/2009 şi (UE) nr. 648/2012
English_translation: Law nr.24/2017 on issuers of financial instruments and market operations /// Regulation nr.5/2018 of the Financial Supervisory Authority on issuers of financial instruments and market operations /// Law No 158/2020 amending, supplementing and repealing certain legislative acts and laying down implementing measures for Regulation (EU) 2017/2.402 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 12 December 2017 laying down a general framework for securitisation and creating a specific framework for simple, transparent and standardised securitisation, and amending Directives 2009/65/EC, 2009/138/EC and 2011/61/EU and Regulations (EC) No 1060/2009 and (EU) No 648/2012
Short Description: Increased shareholder rights at general meetings to reduce excessive risk-taking, including increased transparency regarding remuneration and related party transactions, and harmonization of shareholder meetings across Europe.

The Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD) "provides for the minimum harmonization of rules relating to interest expense deductions, controlled foreign companies (CFCs) and hybrid mismatches, and requires the introduction of a corporate general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) and an exit tax" https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/services/tax/perspectives/atad-survey.html.

Local_language: Ordonanţa Guvernului nr.5/2020 pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr.207/2015 privind Codul de procedură fiscală /// Legea nr. 123/2021 privind aprobarea Ordonanței Guvernului nr. 5/2020 pentru modificarea și completarea Legii nr. 207/2015 privind Codul de procedură fiscală.
English_translation: Government Order No nr.5/2020 amending Law No nr.207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure /// Law No 123/2021 approving Government Order No 5/2020 amending Law No 207/2015 on the Code of Fiscal Procedure.
Short Description: DAC 6 prescribes mandatory disclosure rules for intermediaries in order to counter aggressive international tax planning. If certain "hallmarks" are met, an automatic exchange of said information takes place between relevant tax authorities.
Introduction of a single electronic reporting format (eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL). Mandatory marking of notes to the financial statements should be applied from 1 January 2022.

Local_language: Ordonanţa nr.6/2020 pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr.227/2015 privind Codul fiscal, precum şi pentru reglementarea unor măsuri fiscal-bugetare /// Ordonanţa nr.6/2020 pentru modificarea şi completarea Legii nr.227/2015 privind Codul fiscal, precum şi pentru reglementarea unor măsuri fiscal-bugetare
English_translation: Order No nr.6/2020 amending Law No nr.227/2015 on the Fiscal Code and laying down certain fiscal measures /// Order No nr.6/2020 amending Law No nr.227/2015 on the Fiscal Code and laying down certain fiscal measures
Short Description: The second  Anti Tax Avoidance Directive (ATAD 2) aims to neutralize hybrid mismatches between related entities, i.e. it prevents situations of double deductions or double taxation.

EU taxonomy regulation, a cornerstone of the EU’s Green Deal, entered into force on 12 July 2020. From 1 January 2022, large public interest entities are required to disclose alignment with the taxonomy in relation to the first two objectives (Art 8&9 SFDR products). From 1 January 2023, large public interest entities are required to disclose Taxonomy-alignment in relation to all environmental objectives (financial undertakings from 1 January 2024).

Local_language: Lege nr. 431/2023 privind asigurarea unui nivel minim global de impozitare a grupurilor de întreprinderi multinaționale și a grupurilor naționale de mari dimensiuni
English_translation: Law 431/2023 on ensuring a global minimum level of taxation for multinational enterprise groups and large-scale domestic groups
Short Description: "Pillar Two establishes a minimum tax system with a minimum effective tax rate (ETR) of 15% at the jurisdictional level. Companies with global turnover above EUR 750m will be within the scope of Pillar Two. Where the effective tax rate (ETR) is below the agreed minimum, the new system will top up the tax liability so that the overall rate will reach the established minimum in each jurisdiction where the taxpayer is resident." (https://www.pwc.nl/en/services/tax/taxation-of-the-digital-economy/pillar-two.html)

"IFRS 17 provides consistent principles for all aspects of accounting for insurance contracts. It removes existing inconsistencies and enables investors, analysts and others to meaningfully compare companies, contracts and industries." (ifrs.org). The EU endorsed the standard with an optional exemption regarding the annual cohort requirement (IFRS 17.22).

Local_language: Ordin al ministrului finanțelor nr. 85/2024 pentru reglementarea aspectelor referitoare la raportarea privind durabilitatea. /// Norma 4/2024 privind modificarea și completarea Normei Autorității de Supraveghere Financiară nr. 39/2015 pentru aprobarea Reglementărilor contabile conforme cu standardele internaționale de raportare financiară, aplicabile entităților autorizate, reglementate și supravegheate de Autoritatea de Supraveghere Financiară din Sectorul instrumentelor și investițiilor financiare, precum și Fondului de Compensare a Investitorilor
English_translation: Order of the Minister of Finance No 85/2024 regulating matters relating to sustainability reporting. /// Rule 4/2024 amending and supplementing the Financial Supervisory Authority’s Rule No 39/2015 approving the accounting rules in accordance with international Financial Reporting Standards, applicable to entities authorised, regulated and supervised by the Financial Supervisory Authority for the Financial Instruments and Investment Sector and the Investors Clearing Fund
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms that are already subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2024 data.

Multinational groups with revenues of EUR 750 million have to report information for every tax jurisdiction. In 2014, the European Union introduced country-by-country reporting requirements already to the banking industry.

Local_language: Ordin al ministrului finanțelor nr. 85/2024 pentru reglementarea aspectelor referitoare la raportarea privind durabilitatea. /// Norma 4/2024 privind modificarea și completarea Normei Autorității de Supraveghere Financiară nr. 39/2015 pentru aprobarea Reglementărilor contabile conforme cu standardele internaționale de raportare financiară, aplicabile entităților autorizate, reglementate și supravegheate de Autoritatea de Supraveghere Financiară din Sectorul instrumentelor și investițiilor financiare, precum și Fondului de Compensare a Investitorilor
English_translation: Order of the Minister of Finance No 85/2024 regulating matters relating to sustainability reporting. /// Rule 4/2024 amending and supplementing the Financial Supervisory Authority’s Rule No 39/2015 approving the accounting rules in accordance with international Financial Reporting Standards, applicable to entities authorised, regulated and supervised by the Financial Supervisory Authority for the Financial Instruments and Investment Sector and the Investors Clearing Fund
Short Description: Detailed reporting on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Firms not currently subject to the Non-Financial Reporting Directive report on 2025 data.

Milestones: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosure in Financial Statements
Local_language: IFRS 18 - Presentation and Disclosures in Financial Statements
Short Description: IFRS 18 defines and harmonizes (additional) subtotals in the profit and loss statement, requires disclosures about management-defined performance measures, and introduces principles for grouping of information. IFRS 18 is not yet endorsed by the European Commission.

Local_language: Not yet transposed into national law
Short Description: The  Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) was published on 5 July 2024. Large companies must conduct due diligence to identify, prevent, mitigate, and report on human rights and environmental impacts throughout their supply chain. From 26 July 2027, EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro and >5000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >1500 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.
Slovakia reduced the corporate tax rate by 5 percentage points (from 45 to 40 percent).
Slovak Auditing Standards became obligatory for all auditors.
Slovakia reduced the corporate tax rate by 11 percentage points (from 40 to 29 percent).
Slovakia reduced the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 29 to 25 percent).
Replaces the "old" Accounting Act No. 563/1991.
Joined the European Union on May 1st, 2004
Slovakia reduced the corporate tax rate by 6 percentage points (from 25 to 19 percent).

Local_language: Zákon č. 659/2004 Z. z., ktorým sa mení a dopĺňa zákon č. 595/2003 Z. z. o dani z príjmov v znení neskorších predpisov /// Zákon č. 621/2007 Z. z., ktorým sa mení a dopĺňa zákon č. 595/2003 Z. z. o dani z príjmov v znení neskorších predpisov a o zmene zákona č. 431/2002 Z. z. o účtovníctve v znení neskorších predpisov
English_translation: Act No 659/2004 amending Income Tax Act No 595/2003, as amended /// Act No 621/2007 amending Income Tax Act No 595/2003, as amended, and amending Act No 431/2002 on accounting, as amended
Short Description: Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.

Local_language: Zákon č. 635/2004 Z. z., ktorým sa mení a dopĺňa zákon č. 566/2001 Z. z. o cenných papieroch a investičných službách a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov (zákon o cenných papieroch) v znení neskorších predpisov a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov /// Zákon č. 747/2004 Z. z. o dohľade nad finančným trhom a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov
English_translation: Act No 635/2004 amending Act No 566/2001 on securities and investment services and amending certain acts (the Securities Act), as amended, and amending certain acts /// Act No 747/2004 on financial market supervision and amending certain acts
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.
IFRS is required for public interest entities (PIE).

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).

Local_language: Zákon č. 530/2003 Z. z. o obchodnom registri a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov /// Zákon č. 657/2007 Z. z., ktorým sa mení a dopĺňa zákon č. 513/1991 Zb. Obchodný zákonník v znení neskorších predpisov a o zmene a doplnení zákona č. 530/2003 Z. z. o obchodnom registri v znení neskorších predpisov
English_translation: Act No 530/2003 on the Commercial Register and amending certain acts /// Official publication: Collection of Laws of the Slovak Republic; Number: 219 ; Publication date: 2003-12-12 ; Page: 4098-4107
Short Description: Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers.
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 5 years to 7 years.

The Markets in Financial Instruments Directive (MiFID I) came into force on 1 November 2007 and created a single European financial service market. For example, financial service providers approved by one EU country could operate across the EU ('EU passport').
Disclosures of off-balance sheet arrangements and related party transactions.
Minimum requirements for statutory audits. Statutory audits may only be carried out by approved auditors. Firms are required to disclose the individual auditor responsible for the engagement.
The Directive states that the standard rate of the value-added tax (VAT) may not be lower than 15% and a maximum of two reduced rates not lower than 5%. The Directive allows for exemptions.

"IFRS 8 requires an entity whose debt or equity securities are publicly traded to disclose information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the different business activities in which it engages and the different economic environments in which it operates." (ifrs.org)
Euro area member since 1 January 2009.

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Since 2009 all Slovak taxpayers have to report the value of intra-group transaction in CIT form and follow a guideline of obligatory transfer pricing documentation (2 versions full and simplified exist)" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)
Increased shareholder rights, including timely access to all information relevant to general meetings.
The merger directive prescribes the possibility for enterprises to conduct cross-border mergers in the Union without adverse tax effects

Local_language: Zákon č. 595/2003 Z. z. o dani z príjmov
Short Description: Abolished withholding taxes on dividend distributions paid by subsidiary companies to their parent company within the EU.

“IFRS 10 establishes principles for presenting and preparing consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities. IFRS 10 (a) requires an entity (the parent) that controls one or more other entities (subsidiaries) to present consolidated financial statements, (b) defines the principle of control, and establishes control as the basis for consolidation, (c) sets out how to apply the principle of control to identify whether an investor controls an investee and therefore must consolidate the investee, (d) sets out the accounting requirements for the preparation of consolidated financial statements and (e) defines an investment entity and sets out an exception to consolidating particular subsidiaries of an investment entity.” (ifrs.org)

"IFRS 13 defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). When measuring fair value, an entity uses the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or the liability under current market conditions, including assumptions about risk. As a result, an entity’s intention to hold an asset or to settle or otherwise fulfil a liability is not relevant when measuring fair value." (ifrs.org)
Slovakia increased the corporate tax rate by 4 percentage points (from 19 to 23 percent).

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2021
Short Description: "IFRS 12 requires an entity to disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate: the nature of, and risks associated with, its interests in a subsidiary, a joint arrangement, an associate or an unconsolidated structured entity; and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows." (ifrs.org)

Slovakia introduced a statutory minimum tax for corporations, which had to be paid annually even if firms had no profit. The minimum tax had three levels, depending on the yearly turnover. The reform also allowed corporations to apply a special form of tax carry-forwards starting in 2015.

Paper: Sarquis, dos Santos, Lourenço, and Braunbeck 2022
Short Description: "IFRS 11 establishes principles for financial reporting by entities that have an interest in arrangements that are controlled jointly (joint arrangements). A joint arrangement is an arrangement of which two or more parties have joint control. Joint control is the contractually agreed sharing of control of an arrangement, which exists only when decisions about the relevant activities (ie activities that significantly affect the returns of the arrangement) require the unanimous consent of the parties sharing control." (ifrs.org)

Local_language: Zákon č. 563/2009 Z. z. o správe daní (daňový poriadok) a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov /// Zákon č. 442/2012 Z. z. o medzinárodnej pomoci a spolupráci pri správe daní /// Zákon č. 442/2012 Z. z. o medzinárodnej pomoci a spolupráci pri správe dani
English_translation: Act No 563/2009 on tax administration (Tax Code) and amending certain acts /// Act No 442/2012 on international assistance and cooperation in the administration of taxes /// Act No 442/2012 on international assistance and cooperation in the administration of taxes
Short Description: DAC 1 is the first 'Directive on Administrative Cooperation' and provides for, among others, spontaneous exchanges of information, exchanges on request, the sharing of best practices and requests for notifications on taxpayers. DAC 1 is the first of a series of Directives on administrative cooperations: DAC 2 (Directive 2014/107), DAC 3 (Directive 2015/2376), DAC 4 (Directive 2016/881), DAC 5 (2016/2258), and DAC 6 (Directive 2018/822).
Increased comparability of local GAAP within the EU.

The Transparency Directive introduced quarterly reports for firms listed on EU-regulated markets, which are no longer mandatory. However, many stock exchanges require quarterly reports for specific market segments.
DAC 2 precribes the automatic exchange of financial account information between tax authorities, such as interests, dividends, account balances and gross sale proceeds.

Local_language: Zákon č. 431/2002 Z. z. o účtovníctve /// Zákon č. 333/2014 Z. z., ktorým sa mení a dopĺňa zákon č. 595/2003 Z. z. o dani z príjmov v znení neskorších predpisov a ktorým sa menia a dopĺňajú niektoré zákony /// Zákon č. 423/2015 Z. z. o štatutárnom audite a o zmene a doplnení zákona č. 431/2002 Z. z. o účtovníctve v znení neskorších predpisov
English_translation: Accounting Act No 431/2002 Coll. /// Act No 333/2014 amending Act No 595/2003 on income tax, as amended, and amending certain acts /// Act No 423/2015 on statutory audit and amending Act No 431/2002 on accounting, as amended
Short Description: Increased auditor independence, and more informative audit reports.
The Non-Financial Reporting Directive requires large Public Interest Entities (> 500 employees) to include non-financial reporting as part of their annual reporting requirements.
Improve transparency in the audit market, including mandatory firm rotation, publication of significant risk (key audit matters), and separation of audit and non-audit services.
The Market Abuse Regulation expands the scope of the Market Abuse Directive to non-regulated markets. The aim is to prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
DAC 3 prescribes the automatic exchange of information between tax authorities on advance cross-border rulings (such as place of residence) and advance pricing agreements.
Multinational groups with total consolidated revenue equal or higher than € 750.000.000 have to file country-by-country reports to the tax authorities. The data is not publicly available.
DAC 4 prescribes the automatic exchange of Country-by-Country Reports with regard to revenues, profits, taxes paid and accrued, accumulated earnings, number of employees and certain assets.

Next year, from 26 July 2028, EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro and >3000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >900 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD. Finally, from 26 July 2029, EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro and >1000 employees along with non-EU companies with revenues of >450 Million Euro must comply with the CSDDD.

Local_language: Sklep o določitvi slovenskih računovodskih standardov
English_translation: Resolution on the determination of Slovenian accounting standards
Short Description: The first edition of Slovenian Accounting Standards. The standards not only included financial reporting requirements but also guidance on internal reporting practices.
Slovenia reduced the corporate tax rate by 5 percentage points (from 30 to 25 percent).
Revision of the Slovenian Accounting Standards of 1994.
Joined the European Union on May 1st, 2004

Local_language: Zakon o trgu vrednostnih papirjev /// Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah Zakona o trgu vrednostnih papirjev /// Sklep o poročanju o poslih in o registru poslov oseb, ki so jim neposredno dostopne notranje informacije in z njimi povezanih oseb
English_translation: Securities Market Act /// Act amending the Securities Market Act /// Decree on the reporting of transactions and on the register of transactions of persons to whom inside information and persons associated with them are directly accessible
Short Description: "The Market Abuse Directive (2003/6/EC) aims to prevent insider trading and market manipulation. It contains three key elements: (1) disclosure rules designed to reduce the scope of inside information, (2) ex-post sanctions for insider trading or market manipulation, and (3) tightened enforcement of compliance with insider trading and market manipulation rules (see Moloney [2014])." (Christensen et al. 2016)
Exemption from tax on interest and royalty payments within multinationals within the EU.

Firms listed on EU-regulated markets are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for their consolidated financial statements. Firms that use US GAAP voluntarily are allowed to transition two years later.
Increased IPO prospectus disclosure.
IFRS is voluntary for consolidated and unconsolidated financial statements, mandatory for banks and insurance companies from 2006 (consolidated and unconsolidated).

Introduction of transfer pricing documentation requirements, which makes profit shifting more costly. "Documentation required since 2005. Since 2006, TP documentation for cross-border inter-company transactions must be prepared concurrently; domestic only upon request from the tax authorities during inspection" (Beer and Loeprick 2015)

Local_language: Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah zakona o gospodarskih družbah /// Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah Zakona o sodnem registru
English_translation: Act amending the Companies Act /// Act amending the Court Register Act
Short Description: Introduction of penalties for non-disclosure of financial statements.
Revision of the Slovenian Accounting Standards (SAS). The SAS 2006 are almost completely aligned with the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
Tax loss carryforwards increased from 5 years to 7 years.

The Directive 'lays down measures to coordinate the laws, regulations, administrative provisions, codes of practice […] relating to takeover bids for the securities of companies governed by the laws of Member State" (Directive 2004/25/EC, Article 1).
Introduced a harmonizing legal basis within the European Union for cross-border mergers
Firms listed on EU-regulated markets that previously used US GAAP are required to use the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

English_translation: Financial Instruments Market Act /// Corrigendum to Regulation 2007-01-3699
Short Description: Harmonization of transparency requirements for firms listed on EU-regulated markets. Introduction of mandatory quarterly reporting for publicly listed firms (at least Interim Management Statements on a quarterly basis), and increased disclosure requirements regarding ownership.

"IFRS 7 requires entities to provide disclosures in their financial statements that enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the entity’s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments to which the entity is exposed during the period and at the end of the reporting period, and how the entity manages those risks." (ifrs.org)
Euro area member since 1 January 2007.

Local_language: Zakon o davku od dohodkov pravnih oseb (ZDDPO-2)
Short Description: Required that an expense must be recognized in the income statement to be deductible for tax purposes (Novak and Valentinčič 2017).
